description:
Found out about this place from all their reviews online. Great food and great service. Did not have to wait long to be seated. It's Indian food so there is a lot of vegetarian options. My favorite was the Roti's Dal Makhan, which was lentils of the day slow cooked in cream sauce with garlic, ginger, cumin, turmeric and butter. It was a good portion for $11.  

Overall, I would recommend this place and would come back to try more items on the menu.
author: Carly E.

description:
Just did take out from Roti last night and enjoyed it tremendously. 

Takeout: Excellent and well packaged to avoid spills while staying warm. Every dish was delicious.

Web ordering system: It's not well linked to their menu, e.g. you might need two windows open unless you already know what each dish is.

Food itself: All completely delicious. Everything we ordered was cooked perfectly and well seasoned, nicely spicy. Highly recommend.
author: Erik O.

description:
Love love love this place. I came here on Sunday for dinner with my boyfriend for the first time and my god the food was incredible!

The service was amazing - only had to wait about ~10-15 minutes for our 5 dishes to be brought out. Our server was so attentive and sweet.

We ordered the Paneer Makhani, Bhindi Masala, Garlic Naan, tandoori game hen and yogurt. We asked to get the dishes relatively spicy (7.5/10) but it wasn't actually really spicy at all. So if you like spicy foods, you should aim for an even higher number.

Everything was sooo good. My favorite was the game hen followed by the Paneer Makhani but everything was delightful. Definitely my favorite Indian restaurant out of the places I've tried in my life.
author: Jenny W.

description:
This place was surprisingly packed when I came on Tuesday for date night. We waited for 5 mins until we were seated. Service was amazing; the staff was so nice and service was fast!

We ordered a couple of things on their reg menu (bread basket which comes  with three different kinds of nann bread and the roti shrimp)  andcouple of things on their June speicals menu (fruit salad which has mangos, watermelon and tomatoes with basil and cumin seasoning, and the chicken methi).  Ebrything was delivous. We especially love the chicken methi...it's like a curry, the sauce was so flavorful. We also tried Indian beer for the first time...the the Taj Mahal lager. 

Would definitely come back!!!
author: Caitlin P.

description:
Roti restaurant was closed by the SF health dept. with a large notice
on the door.
author: Peter F.

description:
Great service, great location, good food. We ordered their seasonal butternut squash soup, a chaat fruit salad, paneer makhani, baingan bharta and a kashmiri biryani. The soup was delicious, but a little on the heavy side for a summer appetizer. We ordered two soups between four people, but I still felt very full before the rest of the food even arrived. The chaat fruit salad was delicious, but nothing special - just fruit with some chaat masala sprinkled on. The paneer makhani and baingan bharta were solid, and definitely made the meal. This was my first time experiencing kashmiri biryani, as I generally don't enjoy sweet dishes, but it was very well made and added a different flavor to the meal.

Their service was great - the waiter took into account our request for the dishes to be "Indian" spicy, and the owner came by and personally checked on our table more than once - a very nice gesture, especially on a busy Friday evening.
author: Apoorva A.

description:
One of my absolute favorite restaurants. Food is delicious. My favorite chicken tikka masala. Wonderful chai tea.  Curried Butternut squash soup is delicious. Naan is great and rice is done to perfection Owner and staff are friendly and helpful. 

Another visit, another delicious meal. Tried something new-the tikka chicken salad-delicious. The naan was better than usual, which is saying something. Tamarind and mint chutneys are so good.
author: Maura G.

description: Had the best meal ever here. Food was cooked perfectly and very authentic Indian food.
author: Steve C.

description:
Definitely a solid 4.5 stars.

I thoroughly agree with Geoff G and all my fellow yelpers on Roti Indian Bistro.

Indian cuisines (and Pakistani as well) have just exploded in the San Francisco bay area with the influx of tech workers from the region. Just look at the 2nd street corridor in SOMA.

Indian restaurants usually fall into two categories: either the elegant really expensive kind (August 1 Five, Dosa, Babu Ji etc) and the down and, em dirty lunch buffet places ( which shall go nameless)

Roti Indian Bistro is different!  You get a comfortable, casual, affordable restaurant that wont break the bank.

Service is warm and efficient. The owner usually will help you and hes great.

The ambiance is simple but very clean and you can actually see the kitchen working.

The food is superb. You can actually taste the quality and the care. Foods are not over salted. All the sauces are rich and deep with flavor. Meats are good cuts and not cheap and fatty.

6 People, a couple of drinks, and tons of food: $25 per person is pretty good.

Highly recommend checking them out
author: David G.

description:
My family and I have been coming to Roti Indian Bistro for years, as it is our go-to for Indian food at a nicer-than-average restaurant. The service is great, and the food is plentiful and tasty, and you aren't breaking the bank as you would at some of the other higher end Indian restaurants in San Francisco.

For those looking for truly "authentic" Indian food, Roti is a great place to start. While they boast their modern Indian cuisine and get creative with their naans, you are getting the traditional flavors of North India with every dish.

Roti's staff and service create a warm and welcoming vibe, which simply enhances your dining experience. They are responsive and friendly, and the owner will take time to meet with you, and check up on you.

For vegetarians, I recommend the paneer makhani, the navrattan korma, and palak paneer. Always get the "Roti's Bread Basket" so you can taste a variety of naans, including my personal favorite, the garlic and basil naan.

Parking isn't always easy so plan to spend a few extra minutes looking on the side streets to park. It's all worth it!
author: Sejal D.

description:
I love Roti. 

Their chicken Korma is so beautiful it always makes an appearance when we order. Additionally, the fish curry is also delicious. The fish is usually Salmon but the menu says it is fish of the day. 

Why do I love Roti? 

When you dine in, the ambiance makes you feel dreamy, comfortable, ready to eat. 

The service is consistently friendly and professional. 

The wine list is a-ok. 

The food is so mind numbing my delicious I feel betrayed when my deceptively small portions spooned onto my plate make me feel full so fast. 

Also, when they say medium spicy - it is actually spicy so don't start whining that the food was too hot. I love that. I tire of restaurants whose "spicy" is actually mild. Don't dumb down my palate! Roti's medium is moderately spicy, and the spicy will make your body sweat. I love that esp on cold winter nights! 

Cream, spices, nuts, and protein will do that to you. 

I have also ordered delivery multiple times. When they deliver, everything is piping hot, containers are filled to brim, and the food arrives really fast. 

Roti, thank you for feeding my family so well over the years. 

Now if the San Mateo location were anything like this location - id go there a lot too! 

My favorites: 
Veggie Samosas

Chicken Pakoras

Chicken Korma Medium Spicy 

Garlic Naan 

Basmati 

Interestingly enough I do not like the spinach here. It isn't the end of the world, just a taste preference.

Clearly I manage to eat just fine without it. 

Go, eat, enjoy! (Wear stretchy pants to avoid having to unbutton under the table because you will eat well!) 

Five stars for perfection and my continued local patronage.
author: Jennifer C P.

description: Delicious and accommodating! Our server identified all the items on the menu that could be made vegan (of which there were many!)-- including modifying the vegetarian thali for us. Stellar service and stellar food. My favorite restaurant on West Portal.
author: Anastasia Z.

description:
It is in the middle of Hayes Valley, but there are trams that are right out front for those seeking public transportation. Street parking may be difficult. Perhaps Uber or Lyft or the best options to reach this location.

The portions of wine and beers are very generous, and the beers are closer to room temperature favored in the UK rather than a cool, cold beer. Several selections of local or more popular options.

All the food is really delicious, and the onion naan was surprisingly a favorite. Again, very generous servings with large portions of rice provided. The service is exceptional, being fast, helpful and super friendly.

Definitely worth it. Definitely coming back.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
Went here for lunch. Food and service were excellent .
Menu for weekday lunch is limited but the food is tasty.
We got the karai paneer which came with salad and naan. It was a bit more oily than I would want it but the taste was great. 
We even got the puri with paneer bhujia which was good as well, maybe a little sweet
Food was prepared fresh and came to us piping hot.
Overall happy with the food and service. 
Would definitely visit again.
author: Pooja M.

description:
Best navratan korma anywhere! It had a nice surprise of pineapple.

I would not describe the service as friendly, but that's ok, the food is totally worth it! I can't wait to go back for a 3rd visit within a month. Yuuuuuum.
author: Theresa G.

description:
this is now my favorite indian restaurant in the city!

- fairly easy parking (as it's in west portal)
- no wait (.. as it's in west portal)
- spacious & beautiful interior (a classy looking place - most indian restaurants in the city tend to be casual and don't have much ambiance)
- great value for the money even with the beautiful interior!
- clean bathroom
- friendly, attentive, and quick service!! seriously, service was like it was for a michelin restaurant.. okay, maybe not on THAT level, but pretty damn near it.

my husband had some for a birthday event before and said the food was phenomenal. i wanted to try it for myself especially since I had never heard of the place before (esp. being a foodie). so happy to say it lived up to the hype!

mango lassi - the best i've had. perfectly balanced in terms of both flavor and texture
lamb korma - the sauce. THE SAUCE!! so freakin good. and the lamb was high quality as well, no gamey taste! perfectly tender and could pick it apart with just my fork.
garlic naan - ahhh, so good. again, very top tier stuff, not too doughy and thick.

i want to come back to try ALL THE THINGS!
author: Emily C.

description:
One of the best restaurant ever.
Good Food 
Excellent Customer Service
The staff and the owner Mr Shah, everyone is so attentive and nice.
If you are in SFO and you have not reserve a table here than honestly your taste buds are missing out on awesome food along with excellent customer service.
author: Chanda B.

description: This restaurant is fantastic!  They have great food, service, and family friendly atmosphere; definitely my favorite!!
author: Andy M.

description: Roti is my ABSOLUTE favorite restaurant in the Bay Area! The food is incredible, and the servers are so so nice and just put a smile on your face!! Whenever we're in the area we always make a point of stopping for dinner, and it never disappoints. The restaurant is always busy, and has such a lively aesthetic, making it such a fun place to be! It is such a great environment to be in, and as mentioned before, the food is unlike anything else!
author: Eleanor W.

description:
The interior of this place is so fancy- but it wasn't booked up and there wasn't a wait when my friend and I went on a friday early evening. 

Got the garlic naan (SUPPPERRR strong garlic taste- didn't need any accompaniment. I absolutely loved it). 

I got the mattar paneer (menu description was "Homemade farmer's cheese cooked with green peas, tomatoes, herbs and spices") DELICIOUS. I love my vegetarian curries (esp with green peas) and man did this hit the spot. Ate this with some basmati rice and even had some leftover to bring home and man did I have a good leftover meal the next day. Perfect seasoning and the cheese reminded me of some kind of firm tofu-y texture. 

Pretty reasonably priced too from what I could remember.
author: Linde H.

description:
Where do I even begin?! 

My family of 13 dined at Roti Indian Bistro this past weekend to celebrate a birthday and everything was amazing! First of all, for such a small and intimate restaurant, the staff was very accommodating with the size of our party. We called ahead to make a reservation since there were so many of us and when we arrived, they had tables reserved for us towards the back of the restaurant. 

I'm ashamed to say this, but it was my first time trying Indian food and I can't believe it's taken me this long! The food here at Roti is absolutely wonderful! Everything we ordered was delicious and even the picky eaters in my family found something that they liked!

Cucumber Raita- Homemade yogurt with cucumber, caraway, and cumin. The Raita reminded me of Tzatziki, a similar dish that originates in Greece. Everything tasted good with a dab of Raita on it, especially the Garlic and Basil Naan.

Garlic and Basil Naan- Don't even think twice about it. You have to order this! I don't know what this stuff is made of, but it was flavorful and extremely fresh. I mean, it was so fresh that it was too hot to touch! The Naan was crispy and thin, perfect to dip in the leftover sauce from the Chicken Tikka Masala. Do it!

Roti's Basmati Pulao- Basmati rice cooked with saffron, cumin, cardamon, and bay leaves. Us Filipinos eat just about everything with rice and there was no way in hell that I was going to have curry without rice. It's just not right! The Basmati Pulao smelled wonderful. It was extremely aromatic! Long-grain, similar to Jasmine rice, it was very light and definitely went well with all of the dishes.

Chicken Vindaloo- Would this meal have been complete without curry? Absolutely not, people. The chicken was very tender and the potatoes were cooked just right. Sauce was amazing. I ordered it a little milder than it usually comes because the "hot and spicy" description on the menu scared me. To my surprise, the mild sauce didn't have much spiciness to it. I'd definitely order it again, but next time, bring on the heat! 

Chicken Tikka (Tandoori Specialties)- Boneless chicken breasts marinated with ginger, garlic, spices and herbs. Presentation of this dish was awesome. The chunks of chicken breast were plated on top of mixed vegetables and the entire dish was steaming when the server brought it out from the kitchen. Don't forget to squeeze a little fresh lemon on the chicken!

Roti serves the dishes family-style, so the portions are huge. The menu is reasonably priced, considering you're in West Portal. No complaints here!

Our dining experience at Roti was amazing and I'm looking forward to my next visit to San Francisco just to eat here again! The staff was friendly and professional, ambiance of the restaurant was very warm and relaxing, and the food was of good quality. Thank you, Roti!
author: Jordan I.

description:
My wife and I stopped by here tonight to order take out. We talked the gentleman at the front (host? owner?) and he was delightful..such a nice guy and offered us drinks while we waited. 

We ordered The Goat Cheese Naan, Roti, Tikka Masala and Channa Masala and it was ready within 10 minutes of us placing the order. We drove home (about 15 minutes) and opened it up to find it piping hot...what a nice surprise.

The food was delicious. Really good. We enjoyed it quite a bit. 

Anyway, would highly recommend eating here! Prices were reasonable as well.
author: Patrick T.

description:
We ventured out of our usual haunts, and came up here.  We drove, but the K Ingleside goes by right I front.  The evening started well with easy Rock Star parking tight in front.  

We were hungry!   A busy Memorial Day weekend left us wanting good food.  Roti did not disappoint.  It was a quieter night, being a Tuesday, but the service was stellar.  Personal, attentive and with smiles.  

From appetizer to main,  nothing was precious.   I would it all ABUNDANT!   The butternut squash soup was yummy, with a half bowl enough for one for sure.   Bengan pakora, Calamari pakora... so good and so much.  Good portion on lamb popsicles.... how can you call them popsicles, call it a rack!  The chicken special was Murgh Malai, and again, generous.  We ordered one rice (huge!) and 2 roti (order one for two people) and the Mango Chutney had to have been have a jar!   I have lunch for tomorrow because it was so generous!  Dessert of Kheer rice pudding - again, one serve was enough for two.

What a nice change to venture West, and we will be back.   Thank you so much!!!
author: Todd M.

description:
After all these years of dining at Roti I had the best service experience the other day. I truly fell the need to note this since my past few dinner visits with my husband were less than stellar... busy servers ignoring us, taking forever to hand off the bill, no refills, etc. 

I took my good friend and her three month old baby (my godson) out for lunch. She's never eaten Indian food and I insisted on Roti. 

Setting: It was an exceptionally busy weekday (Thursday) lunch. NEVER have I EVER seen that many groups of people at Roti for lunch at 11:55 in the morning. EVER. 

Danny was the only server working. He immediately greeted us, saw our reservation, and provided adequate space for the baby. Danny was polite and answered food questions thoughtfully. His performance was impressive, as Danny was the only server managing eight tables. 

He never rushed us, food came efficiently, hot chai tea cups were always full. 10/10 for Danny. Great job!

Pro Tip 1: Roti lunch hours are very limited. 11:30-1:45. If you show up at 1pm or after they will not seat you for lunch. Their cuisine takes time to prepare and serve. This ain't BK. You can't stroll in late and have it your way. 

Pro Tip 2: ALWAYS make a reservation!!! Especially for lunch!
author: Rosalyn W.

description:
We weren't too far away, and trying to think of where to go for dinner for a group of three on a Thursday night.  Roti was closing in about 30 minutes from when we got there, but they graciously took us and had no problems with us taking our time to dine there.  Hubs has been here before years ago.  Roti is a nicer Indian place with slightly higher prices, and you don't smell like curry when you leave, that's a plus!

To start off we all ordered a mango lassi.  It was thick, creamy, and flavorful.  One of, if not the best lassi I've had to date.  We also ordered: an order and a half of samosas (one order includes two), garlic naan, chicken tikka masala, a special tandoori cornish hen, and palak paneer (spinach paneer), and an order of basmati rice.  Part of me thinks we over ordered, or maybe because all the food came close together, but portions were generous too.  Samosas were thick and spiced right.  I would've wanted them warmer though.  The tikka masala was moist but could've used more flavor in my opinion.  I always love soaking up the extra sauce with the naan, and their garlic naan was perfectly crispy, not too thick, and I could actually taste the garlic  - during and after.  The cornish hen was a bit difficult to eat as they were served halfwise.  I liked the spices and it was moist, but wished it was meatier.  I appreciated how the cornish hen was served with mixed greens, because I'm all about getting  more veggies for a well balanced meal.  I had to try it as it was a special, but next time I would've preferred just sticking with traditional tandoori chicken or ordering another vegetarian dish.  I typically don't care for paneer, but their spinach paneer was so good!  The spinach wasn't bitter at all, the paneer was mild and the mix was blended well.  The basmati rice was standard.  

Service was attentive enough, bathroom was clean, and the restaurant has nice decor.  I don't believe there's many options for Indian food in the general area (one would probably need to head to the Richmond), and Roti has nicer decor than most Indian restaurants, but for more flavor, but not necessarily spice, as I like it more mild - slightly medium on the spice level, I'd suggest hitting other Indian restaurants that are a bit more friendlier on their wallet as well.  Menu highlights here though for me, again, the mango lassi, the spinach paneer and the garlic naan!
author: Cat C.

description:
A nice Indian place around the area.  Good quality, tasty food, very filling.

The few curries we tried were sweet.  We ordered the Murgh Madras and I loved the raisins that were in it.  For the Machchi Masala with salmon, the curry was a bit bland.  However, overall they were all great.
author: Karen L.

description: This place used to be very good. Now every time I go there I'm disappointed. I tried the Saag Paneer and it was soooo under seasoned. Saag paneer usually tastes buttery flavorful but lately theirs has tasted like plain boiled/blended spinach. Not worth the price. At this point, I would have rather gotten Indian food from the mall.
author: Nanu S.

description:
My husband and I love Indian food and this has become one of our favorite spots in San Francisco to eat it.  The spices are exceptionally vibrant.  Our server told us that they grind all their own spices by hand week by week, and it really shows.  So delicious and very vegan-friendly when you ask for help ordering.

4 instead of 5 stars because it's a bit crowded and noisy for us.
author: Roberta J.

description:
Where do I even begin?

My group of 4 dined at Roti Indian Bistro last weekend to not celebrate anything and boy was the service lackluster. Asked for a chai that never came. The Kitchen couldn't seems to handle a simple order of 3 curries and 2 appetizers. 

I'm not ashamed to say that I AM Indian and the food was American Indian at best.
Chicken Pakoras were like Chicken Strips with added spices. The Murgh masala was good but the Okra was perfunctory.

If they told us, that their specialities are the crowd pleasing Tikka Masalas we would have stuck with them rather than being adventurous and ending up with mouths and wallets empty.
author: Ashok R.

description:
I came here on Saturday (6/23). It was day 1 of Pride and a lot of restaurants on this street we're closed. Roti Indian Bistro was one of the few that were open so I wanted to give it a try. Let me start of by saying I am so GLAD that I did! The staff are so incredibly friendly and helpful. I didn't catch the waitress's name, but she was the only blonde haired/Caucasian/female working there. She was so nice to me and was patient with me as I looked over the menu. I let them know that someone would be joining me in about an hour but that I wanted to get started with some food. They were very kind and understanding. I ordered the vegetarian samosas, Chana masala, and garlic naan. The food was delicious and it was beautifully plated. My girlfriend joined me as soon as she got off work (I was sitting for about 45 minutes). They brought her some dishware and silverware and were so polite. They gave her a menu and we ordered chicken tikka masala and a side of basmati rice. My girlfriend is sensitive to spice so we asked if they could make the chicken tikka masala not spicy. Normally Indian restaurants won't make this accommodation, but it never hurts to ask. We were happily surprised when they said they could make it not spicy! When they brought the food out, it was so good! 

Overall, I was very impressed with the customer service, food, and atmosphere of this fine restaurant. The staff is LGBT friendly and this is such a nice thing to see. Yes it's in San Francisco, but trust me when I say that not all places are ok/polite when serving LGBT customers. I will definitely be coming here again.
author: Jasmine V.

description: Seasonally sourced vegetables; friendly, professional service; carefully hand made spice blends; and delicious, unique recipes make this family-run place a neighborhood favorite. I love the bread selection, any lamb fishes, and whatever vegetables are being featured that day. The calamari is also delicious. Save room for chai and house made ice cream! A great place for birthdays and family events!
author: Aileen J.

description: This place is great for Indian food. Interior is nice and warm. We had a lot to choose from. We got shrimp vindaloo, chicken biryani, vegetable pakora, and roti. I was stuffed. The chicken biryani was spot on as good as it gets.The presentation was good. The prices are a bit high and the food came out slow. The owners are friendly. I was with my friend Vinay, who is Indian(so you know it's good and authentic). Would come back here in West Portal for a nice Indian meal.
author: Denise C.

description: I am a San Francisco native and am really glad this place is near my house. It's so flavorful and not too expensive. Being vegetarian there are more options than most Indian places and I'm glad they are fairly priced compared to the meat dishes. Went here recently with mom and boyfriend and they loved it too. The bread basket was awesome and the curries are all so good! I am picky with my Indian food because I love the balance of the buttery base along with the curry spices and to get it perfectly done is not easy to find. They nail it here! I also love the ambiance, cleanliness, and the fact that it is a family owned and operated restaurant. Highly recommend. Best restaurant in West Portal.
author: Cassandra T.

description:
I thought I had made a mental bookmark of Roti Indian Bistro West Portal after viewing a rerun on "Checks Please" but I didn't realize  that the show featured its sister restaurant in San Mateo that had since closed. Yelp confirmed my confusion and so West Portal it was gonna be! lt turned out fortuitous anyway  as the evening was indeed memorable. 

West Portal is a charming and quaint little shopping enclave with a plethora of unique stores and eateries. It used to be my stomping ground when I lived in this 'hood years ago. Parking might be a little challenging though not impossible. As we walked in, I noticed the subdued lighting with an open kitchen against the back wall and pleasing color schemes on the sidewalls. The ambiance was eye soothing with contemporary artwork adorning the walls and none of the boisterous conviviality of Bollywood that is often associated with other Indian restaurants. The furniture though was a little dated and I'm sure that would be an easy fix. 

I am usually a sucker for specials regardless of whether they're daily, weekly or monthly. Something unusual caught my eye. How would Spicy Tomato, Mango, Papaya Chaat ($8) grab you? It turned out to be a refreshing fruit salad using authentic Indian ingredients like grounded cumin, crushed black peppers, chopped mint leaves and fresh ginger and lime juice. The heirloom tomatoes were sweet, the fruits were just ripe giving a good crunch and boy, the whole platter was scrumptious as well! (4/5)

Continuing on with the monthly special was a Tandoori Chicken Hen ($18). I have to admit I am not too sure what the technical difference is between a game hen and chicken but as a consumer, I do know from experience the former is usually smaller size-wise, the meat is tenderer and costs a little more. With this in mind, I've to say RIB's tandoori hen was the most mouth-watering tandoori bird I have ever bitten into! This is a classic Indian preparation in a tandoor (clay oven) that consisted of a hen roasted in mesquite charcoal after being marinated in Indian spices and yogurt. There was a fragrant blackened char on the edges; the meat was moist and fried chicken was no contest. (5/5)

I have a soft spot for lamb chops that is now becoming a rarity in an Indian restaurant. So a Lamb Chop Masala ($22) was a no brainer although it didn't occur to me before ordering it was another tandoori dish. It did result in tandoori overkill. I assume masala refers to garam masala, an exotic blend of Indian spices that was rubbed into the lamb chops.  Again, like the tandoori hen, the charring on the ribs brought out the best of the tandoor. The only negative was the meat was a tad salty. Although I am not on a low sodium diet, I am still mindful of my sodium intake. (4/5)

As far as I am concerned, no Indian meal is quite complete without a curry dish. I opted for the quintessential Chicken Vindaloo ($15). It paled compared to the tandoori dishes as it lacked the fragrance and tastes from the mystifying concoction of spices and I didn't just mean the heat. Strangely, I enjoyed being kicked while savoring Indian curries! The gravy was watered down with no discernable oomph! It wasn't bad but definitely not the best. (3/5)

The owner was an unassuming soft-spoken man who periodically checked in with us in his low-keyed manner and without being disruptive or intrusive.  He surprised us by comping us the fruit salad as a token of his appreciation that we drove the distance to eat at his establishment. He had unwittingly gained our loyalty!
author: Geoff G.

description:
This is our favorite Indian restaurant and we love our Indian food! Whenever we want take out, we think of here first. Friendly staff over the phone, delivers in great time, and the portion sizes are perfect too! I usually have brought for dinner and lunch the next day. My husband not so much as he loves it too much to save any! 

I also love that you can ask for different spice levels. I love medium to hot myself, but when I forget to ask, the give me mild and it's just as tasty.
author: Fiona S.

description:
This is one of the best Indian restaurants i have ever dined in and I spent many years of my life in a community with dozens of them. For starters, the ambiance was casual but nice. Naans and roti were great and the "tandoori calamari" was perfectly cooked with just the right mix of "fried" and "calamari" tastes. 

For my main course, I had the whole game hen. It was terrific and juicy and had a lot of spice but was not cripplingly hot. Also got to sample the lamb lollipops which were cooked to perfection. 

I am from out-of-town but would definitely put this on my "must visit" list for future trips back to the Bay Area.
author: Rich T.

description:
You can order online from their website now! 
Also I have become very enamored with their wheat breads- they are very good.
author: saru k.

description: Did a take out of chicken korma and aloo gobi. Loved the korma. Gobi was decent. The naans taken were the basket where u get different types of naans which were all good. Overall good food and would recommend it if in SF.
author: Akash B.

description: Excellent place offering modern touch of Indian cuisine. We tried the selection of naan breads, tandoori lamb and hen, rice, appetizers, all was cooked to perfection. Impeccable service, impressive menu, great food.
author: Zeev S.

description:
Yah, it's a cool, swankier alternative to Irving's Naan 'N' Curry (which is the superior selection even given its historical inconsistency), but why pay more for mediocre?

Everything tastes watered down. The curry, the texture of the breads, the soggy rice, even the sauces they give you for takeout quickly dissolve their flavor upon sprinkling. Way overpriced for the quality, whether you're dining in or out. I will say the meats are better-quality than most places I've eaten, i.e., they don't taste like a Punjabi McNugget.

Service is fairly quick dining in, but slow dining out (and for that quality, ugh). Interior arrangement feels a bit cramp and the table designations haphazard, noticed customers moving in odd lines.

Anyway, will not be coming back. My parents swear by this place, and now I've to break their hearts.
author: First Name L.

description: On our first visit, the staff, especially the owner, seemed distracted and preoccupied. They weren't in tune with us or many of the other diners. The most disturbing was when our server started to gather our leftovers to box up. She accidentally dropped half a lemon from one of our plates. The owner walked by, picked up the lemon and put it on my husband's dinner plate! He never addressed us or said anything to the server. We were shocked that he would pick something off the floor and put it on a customer's plate. We expressed our shock to the server but she had no reaction or response. It was like they were zombies without any emotion. Really made me wonder about their sanitary practices in general (like, what happens in the kitchen or areas we can't see?!?) and their low health score. Eek. We won't go back nor would we recommend this place.
author: Tone C.

description: Ate here for the first time last night & I have to say it's my new fave Indian restaurant.What makes it so different is the finer quality of the food.We had Tandoori Murgh Malai,Tandoori Game Hen & Chicken Biryani.All were exceptionally well crafted & delicious.We could really taste the high quality ingredients.We are excited to be eating our leftovers again tonight!!
author: Andee F.

description: I've been to a lot of Indian restaurants over the years and I say Roti Indian Bistro is in the top of my list of great Indian food.  They have dishes from different regions of India. It's been a few weeks since we were there but we had a couple of the traditional dishes along with one of their specials and all were equally appetizing.  The most memorable thing I got out of eating here was the food was seasoned perfectly and had a clean finish it wasn't  oily or greasy.  The prices are a little high but it's on par with the rest of the west portal restaurants.  If you're even remotely in the mood for Indian, this is the place to go.  The only thing I wish they had was a aloo naan. Then they would get 6 stars :)
author: Mike S.

description:
Roti was really good for a family dinner. We shared a Vegetarian Thali, the Roti's Feast (both combo platters) and the Tandoori Paneer and had a huge dinner plus leftovers. 
The Tandoori Paneer was great, and came on a bed of grilled vegetables. The dishes in the Vegetarian Thali, especially the curry roasted cauliflower, the eggplant one, and the Dal, could have been spicier but that may be a matter of personal taste.
The dessert included Gulab Jamun, which are sort of like donut holes, and were delicious.
author: Izzy S.

description: Went with Freind try there tandoori game hen and machi pakora food is good and owner from Mumbai nice guy
author: Gary D.

description: Came to Roti Indian Bistro with the family to celebrate a birthday in the family. The service was great! It was fast and really welcoming. I got the chicken tikka masala. It was good, not the best I had unfortunately. It wasn't creamy enough for me and even though I asked for mild it's pretty spicy. My family also mentioned that the chefs might of had a heavy hand on the spices for their plates. I noticed it on my masala as well. Service is great, some plates were delicious (Roti's Feast aka mixed tandoori). Not for me but for some of my family members they loved  the food.
author: Fidel M.

description:
Problem with a yelp review is it is for the entirety of the restaurant. That is, if one has one bad experience , you write a negative review--they should allow you to make separate reviews--reviews for each visit.  

Regardless,  I normally love this place and would give it a 4, maybe 5 stars.  But last night:

Room temperature (not chilled) white wine, served with room temperature (not hot!) food.  Also,  soggy  naan and under spiced chicken dishes.  This all delivered with service that disappeared for our entire meal.

I hope Roti is not going down hill... I will give one more try and will hopefully have to update my rating.
author: Max L.

description: Awesome place! My favorite things on the menu are navratan korma, chicken tikka masala and bhindi masala
author: Rukmee P.

description: The waiter was amazing, I am vegan, and he suggested what I should order. He was very nice to accommodate my restrictions! The food was so delicious as well! I would definitely come back here again. It was very filling, flavorful, and great presentation. Thanks again!
author: Karen H.

description:
Roti is a really wonderful place for some tasty, reasonably-priced Indian food. The owner is a wonderful person who really enjoys delicious food and delicious wine (hence, the great wine list - as most Indian restaurants I've been before don't normally have a selection like this!). 

The lamb popcicles (lamb chops) are amaaaazing and so is everything else. My go-to is the Chicken Tikka Masala (fave!) and the Saag Paneer. And their seasonal cauliflower is so so good! 

Definitely recommend for a dinner in West Portal.
author: Manami K.

description: My go-to spot for Indian food! The chicken tikki masala is so flavorful and well marinated. The ma'am is light and fluffy. But my favorite dish is the seafood (fish of the day) Korma, usually with salmon. Very creamy. Bon appetite
author: Raniel C.

description: I am regular customer at this place and I wanted to take my colleagues out for a good indian dinner. We were around 25 people and I reserved the place beforehand. Everything was already arranged for us to be seated as closely as possible and the service was excellent. Everyone absolutely loved the food here! I think after that night this restaurant is one of their top Indian food restaurants in the city! The owner even gave us free ice cream as we were celebrating one of my colleague's birthday. Definitely a must try indian restaurant in the city! Love the place.
author: Maha L.

description: My favorite Indian food restaurant . The food is excellent. The owner himself makes sure you are enjoying the food. You will not be disappointed.
author: Lulu S.

description: I love the service here, staff does all they can to ensure your visit goes well. I always end up ordering way more food than I can eat just to try it all. West portal is a nice neighborhood for a quiet dinner or lunch, parking and public transit make it easy.
author: John O.

description: Came here with the bf this past week. Parking is mostly streets or you can park in this parking lot on the back side. We got seated right away and got the menus. We ordered tiki malasala and some duck tandoori and some garlic naan! Mhmm so yummy. We also ordered two mango lassi which was so sweet and refreshing. The garlic naan was a bit burnt but it was still good. The tiki malasala and duck tandoori was also very delicious. It was definitely enough for the two of us. It was so much food but definitely yummy. The waiter was also nice too which is a plus! I think I'll definitely be back for some more!
author: Monica W.

description: R commended by my foodie friends. Went for lunch and the Nandini and chicken tikka massala were both wonderful, perfectly spiced with a bite but nothing extreme heat wise.
author: Mark W.

description:
Horrible place to eat. No idea what these 5 starts are for. Went in with friends. Appetizer was ok. 

Then ordered tandoori which is supposed to be hot. It's chicken for god save.  It was cold seemed undercooked. Asked the waiter to change it. They took the same chicken microwaved or may be just kept under fire for 10 second brought the same exact dish out. Still cold. 
When asked manager about it.  The manager was so damm rude. THIS IS HIS EXACT WORD. "DONT ARGUE "

We are not. arguing we are just requesting right food for the money we are paying.   

Horrible horrible horrible service by the manager 

Waiter was good. Appetizers were good. Rest was horrible with horrible service.
author: Bargain D.

description: Another AMAZING dinner at Roti!  They accommodate young children beautifully.  Food was exceptional.   The Chef has a way with lamb.   Every dish was beautiful and perfect.  Plenty of parking at lot behind off Ulloa at Claremont.   Thank you for another relaxing yummy evening!!!
author: Marilyn T.

description: I love their curry dish! I am very happy for having them so close to me!! I had many wonderful experiences there and I feel that is the best Indian restaurant I have ever been! They are very clean and delicious, respectful and hold a lot of attention to details!
author: Caroline S.

description: While in San Francisco area we got hungry for something filling, what better than Indian food. After our search we stumbled upon Roti, looking over the reviews, we decided to stop in for an early dinner. We started with a chai tea and veggie samosas. The appetizer was great, with the mint dip they serve with it. For our entrees we shared Paneer Jalfrezi (vegetarian dish) and Tandoori Chicken Tikka. Sides- Basmati Pulau rice and regular Naan. The tandoori chicken came out on a hot plate, still sizzling, and the Jalfrezi was steaming hot. Everything was so delicious and super filling. The combo between veggie dish and the chicken dish was perfect. We had the right amount of meat and veggies. The restaurant was set up very unique, with the kitchen being open so we can see them cooking. The waitress Mary was very nice and helpful. She took great care of us. After we finished, they boxed up our leftovers for us very neatly, that's a great perk! Highly recommend.
author: Britany B.

description:
This was a pleasant surprise. Small but classy Indian Bistro way out in West Portal. 
1) the food was great, especially a cauliflower special prepared thru many steps. Sorry cannot remember name. 
2) Service was fast and helpful especially considering the place was slammed. 
3) Ambiance was OK, only because it is small and packed with happy diners. (the line was out the door 45 min after opening) 
4) Roti is run by an older gentleman/owner who genuinely wants to please. 
5) good beer on tap and acceptable wine list but the place needs a full bar.
I will definitely come back as prices are reasonable and it's clean and delicious.
author: WC B.

description:
I am always on the search for the perfect $10 lunch. Here at Roti Indian Bistro in West Portal, I've potentially hit the mother lode. 

Roti is a quiet, congenial, cozy spot on West Portal Avenue and their lunch specials are served alongside a generous portion of warm, bubbly naan bread or puffy, delectable poori (fried puffed wheat bread) accompanied by a small but hearty main dish and a salad. I ordered a tasty vegetarian option of creamy curry with peas and potatoes, Navarrattan Korma, alongside rosemary naan and can recommend it.  Best $10 (plus tax and tip) I've spent in recent memory and another one to add to my new best of San Francisco $10 lunch list. Ordered a second lunch just to confirm its good, and sadly had a bit of a a weaker order, but the naan was still terrific, and for $10, I really can't complain. Make sure to come early --lunch service is over by 1:45 pm, so the chefs can get some downtime before the dinner service.
author: Rachel H.

description: Two friends and I came here for my school assignment that I had to do. Normally I don't go out of my way to go eat Indian food. We found this nearby place and based on the good Yelp reviews, decided to try this place. Upon arriving, we waited a few minutes before a server seated us. The place is very modern and fancy looking (or at least tries to be). It is definitely not an authentic Indian restaurant. The prices of the dishes did not match the portion of the food. For a high price range, I was expecting the food to taste amazing. It was mediocre. We ordered the chicken tikka masala, tandoori duck, goat cheese naan, and two rice basmati. Everything was too salty.
author: Amy T.

description:
What happens when consistent and excellent presentation exceeds expectations upon visiting a restaurant? From my perspective this translates into a beautiful and amazing "DINING EXPERIENCE" and that restaurant is Roti. 

Over the years my wife and I have been visiting Roti but never found the time to give this restaurant a review, but there comes a time when a simple "Thank You" to those who strive to make a positive difference in your day (and possibly in your life) must take precedence over personal and hectic schedules. So here I am. (Ironically, this is the first time I am writing a review on Yelp).

The "Roti Experience" does not start with its exotic and tasty Indian dishes, it actually begins from the moment one enters the restaurant - the warm and friendly greeting by the Host (blended with the melodious and soothing music in the background) sets the tone for your dining experience. Once seated, the picturesque landscape of Roti's interior immediately captures your attention and within a few minutes (while absorbing the beauty and serenity of the moment), you are gracefully intercepted with another hospitable greeting - this time, from your Waiter/Waitress.

Glancing through the menu is another adventurous moment because the "Cultural" dimension of your experience gains momentum with the variety of authentic Indian dishes to choose from. My wife and I have been sampling the different dishes during our visits. However, each time we come to a conclusion as to the best dish on the menu, this thought is immediately erased from our memory when tasting another dish! In other words - everything tastes great!! Despite the extra time it takes to get to San Francisco from where we live in Belmont (due to the heavy traffic any day of the week) it is always a pleasure to visit Roti. The waiting is worth the while because a new and exciting experience always unfolds with each visit. 

The  location, food, service, ambience, and other factors (tangible and intangible) that goes into making Roti uniquely special is the reason why my wife and I will always make this restaurant our first choice (among the many) in the Bay Area. We highly recommend Roti. THANK YOU to the Management and Staff who continually strive for excellence (in each stage of their work) in order to make their customers enjoy a wonderful and gratifying dining experience!
author: Ron B.

description: Great food and really great service. They are very generous with the serving sizes and the prices are definitely fair. The goat cheese naan had a large amount of goat cheese and was spectacular as were the curries and biryani. A man who I believe is the owner asked if we wanted to try their "really hot" hot sauce. I'm so glad we did because I think it was one of the best hot sauces I've had. That definitely put this place over the top. I would recommend this restaurant solely on that! We even asked if they sold the hot sauce. They don't but the owner packed us some to go (: Totally recommend and will be back!
author: Angela W.

description:
Look, I'm gonna say it. Based on the 2 top-rated restaurants we've tried in West Portal, West Portal has 1-2 star inflation. We just moved to a nearby hood, and have started to scope out restaurants. Based on all the awesome reviews, we decided to give this joint a try. We were spoiled to have a couple of amazing Indian restaurants within walking distance in the Mission, and were sooooo hoping Roti would represent.

We used Order Ahead to order, and within about an hour, we had our comestibles. Everything was packed immaculately, the tamarind sauce was not forgotten, and it was thickkkkkk. The yellow lentils were bathed in a rich tomato sauce. The tomato sauce in the lentils, not my thing, yo. Tasty, but again, not my thing. The palak paneer was flavorful, but the paneer was kinda gummy, not soft and chewy in that rightttttt kinda way. The navrattan korma was pretty bada**. Hella vegetables, drenched in a smooth, creamy, rich sauce, and peppered with golden raisins, almonds, and pineapple. The garlic naan was good.

So, would I order from here again? Allow me to serve up some honesty...when we pay $80 for a delivery meal, it should break my mauf, make out with my taste buds, and leave me wanting more. Did any of those things happen? Yes, with the navrattan, but that's just not enough for me to order a whole meal from here again:(
author: Gabriela W.

description:
We went on a Tuesday evening and the place was bustling. The restaurant had a warm ambience and wait staff courteous. 

For the food, we ordered a veg thali and a chicken biryani. Both of the items were good to taste, although it could have been spicier. (Although they do give you a separate sauce if you want to spice it up!). The price is reasonable and along with a few drinks the bill is not too high. 

The manager was super sweet and checked on us if we were having a good time. He even suggested other meal options for lunch hours (buffet option) which is thoughtful. 

The restaurant is in a pleasant neighborhood and since I generally like to finish my dinner with some good dessert or coffee there were many places nearby which serve them. 

Would definitely visit Roti again and would love to try their lunch buffet option.
author: Surbhi V.

description:
I am Indian... and I've eaten Indian food my whole life... and I must say, this place offers the BEST Indian food I have ever eaten. I just moved here from LA and I was wowed, literally said "WOW" with every bite. I had the Chicken Tikka Masala, Saag Aloo, Basmati Rice... and that was enough to wow me. The QUALITY, is what stands out. ****** AMAZING. I thought it was expensive, but you get what you pay for. Five star well deserved. 

-Alicia
author: Alicia M.

description: Local gem! This place has a wonderful balance of amazing food, beautiful art, and kind hearted service. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a out-of-the-way date night. Their chai is very caffeinated, so heads up for evening chai drinkers. I am a big fan of the tandoori chicken.
author: Michael W.

description: Great Indian/Pakistani food.  Warm professional service in a clean nicely decorated space.  Being brought up on my grandmother's Pakistani food I'm pretty picky when it comes to restaurants, but this place is great!  Dishes are prepared well with care and flavors abound.  You can smell the delicious mix of spices as soon as you enter, and you won't be disappointed in the meal.  It's just slightly more expensive than your average Indian restaurant, but well worth the extra few dollars.
author: Sean M.

description: We first went to Roti for dinner and while the food was great and the service was good we thought it was a little over priced. We went back for lunch yesterday with a friend and their lunch menu is fantastic! Not only do you still get the great food and service, you get a really good deal. I got the vegetable curry with naan (it was very tasty) and it came with a salad and chai tea for $10. I was very impressed. My boyfriend also loved his chicken tiki masala so we all left happily full.
author: Jamie T.

description: I have been a loyal customer for 10 years and I cannot express how much I love this place. The owner is so nice and always checks in on his customers to see how their food and experience is. The servers are really nice and always have good recommendations for new food. THE FOOD!!! best Indian food I've ever had! So tasty and good value. Would highly recommend Roti!!
author: Tara C.

description: I got food poisoning here a few days ago. The worst 24 hours ever. I told one person and they said they know someone else who got sick after eating here. That's not just coincidence. I'll avoid the place. I hope you do too. For your own sake, stay away. It must be poor hygiene practices.
author: Baron Z.

description: I went here for the first time for my sweet 16 and it was amazing!! The food was so good and the service was amazing. The atmosphere is very cozy and everything inside is very well thought out. They also gave us really nice reusable containers for the left overs which was nice. Overall, great place:)
author: Sofie G.

description: I am embarrassed to say that having lived in San Francisco for years I've never made it to the west portal neighborhood.  So stupid when it's two stops away on the muni and a delightful neighborhood.  This Indian food was as good as any I've ever had. Went with samosas, vindaloo, naan, basmati rice and masala as well as a fish special. The baby loved everything but particularly loved the mango lassi the owner brought for him. He sipped on basically dessert yogurt. The owner was the highlight. Actually all of the servers. They helped put otto in the high chair, didn't cringe when he screamed and kept coming back to make him smile. It's a big city but this is the kind of family place where you can quickly become a regular.
author: Kierstan G.

description: This place is SO GOOD! Everything I have had here I have loved. My boyfriend always gets the chicken vindaloo and I get the mattar paneer. I've tried several other Indian restaurants throughout the city and nothing tops this place!
author: Adrienne H.

description: Excellent food and good service here. The atmosphere is also warm and welcoming. Would come back some time!
author: Steph L.

description: Great food and good size portions. The wait staff are very nice and helpful explaining the different dishes. The owner is always there and greets just about everyone. I've never had a bad meal here.
author: Michelle M.

description: This spot is great! A friend and I met here for dinner and shared a couple different entrees including the saag aloo, which was amazing. The staff was super accommodating to my vegan diet leaving butter out of everything and even serving me "chai water" which is chai without milk. Delicious! The portions are generous here, so I had lots of yummy leftovers to take home.
author: Laura T.

description: Huge portions of amazing food for incredible value (seriously, try to find more value in San Francisco). What's also really cool is that each item on the menu is a complete meal - a gravy + delicious roti. My husband and I are vegetarians and we just loved the appetizers (bunch of yummy fried goodies) and the paneer gravies were just to die for.
author: Preeti N.

description: This is my favorite Indian restaurant in SF. The owner was very hospitable and made sure me and my lady had a good experience. The food was excellent and exceeded my expectations. I will be returning
author: Brandon M.

description: I've been going here for years. It's a family staple that never disappoints. Thanks for always taking such good care of us.
author: Robin K.

description: Mediocre Indian tailored to suit an imagined Western palate. Had a big dinner here with a friend. I've lived in London, been to India twice, can cook many dishes myself authentically. The service was fine and the lamb was good quality meat but beyond that the food was tasteless and bland, despite asking for medium spice. Anyone who knows the difference will be sorely disappointed. Restaurants shouldn't minimize spices and flavors based on the ethnicity of their patrons. Everything was flavorless. Complex dishes have complex flavor. Throwing meat and vegetables into a "sauce" does not a curry make.
author: Chanel B.

description: My husband and I love Roti. The food is delicious, the service courteous and prompt, and the owners are always there with their beautiful and welcoming smiles.
author: Rima E.

description:
Really good indian food and one of the cleanest in the city. Probably that has a lot to do in terms of quality.
Chicken tikka masala is one of the best in the city, tasty, creamy sauce, and does not destroy your stomach after 30min of eating it. Yup, you know!
author: Eric F.

description:
"We returned salivating at the thought of having the Tandoori Duck that's among - pay attention! - THE BEST DISHES I've ever had in my life but it wasn't on the menu."

The latest visit, it was on the menu by name but, although delicious and otherwise wonderful, it wasn't the same.

The language in the kitchen at many restaurants differs from the language of the cuisine. Roti's kitchen speaks Spanish just as Scoma's kitchen speaks Cantonese.

I agree with what I previously said:
"I'm not going to say this is the best Indian cuisine in town but it might be."
author: Swing C.

description: Outstanding food and service. The noise level can be overwhelming when the restaurant is full, so don't expect a quiet dinner if it's busy. The servers are attentive. I haven't had a disappointing dish yet, whether it's a meat dish or a vegetarian one. If you like spicy food like I do, ask for their house made hot sauce.
author: A L.

description:
This restaurant is just so incredible. SO GOOD. EVERYTHING IS SOOOOO GOOD!
I've been here at least 20 times and I always try to make sure I taste new things and I've seriously never had anything that wasn't excellent. My favorites are the Tandoori Salmon (which I top with a otherworldly mixture of raita, green sauce and hot sauce), Chana masala, paneer makhani and this amazing whole cauliflower dish (that is a seasonal special). Add some garlic and basil naan and prepare to have your mind blown.

Damn I want to go there right this second.
author: K E.

description: Wow. Lunch is very good and priced well. Had seasonal vegetables, rice and cucumber/tomato salad. More than I could eat and $10. Highly recommend.
author: Jamie L.

description:
Ok lets start with basics.  Food is fantastic.  Light and flavorful and fresh.  The staff is kind and attentive and efficient.  I have eaten in and ordered out multiple times and its fantastic every time.

Here is the best part, the fish curries and specials.  Fish curry is an easy dish that's hard to get right.  These guys do it right!  I am always happy after eating here, never feel weighed down and always fuller than I planed on being.

Bottom line, great food, friendly, professional staff and reasonable prices.  What more could you ask for?
author: Paul O.

description:
Looking for a spot last minute to grab dinner, my girlfriend and I decided to give this place a try after seeing it on Yelp. Upon entering, we were greeted by the host who let us choose our table. Once we were seated I noticed he tried his best to level the table which was uneven - very nice of him as most places wouldn't even do this. Our waitress was very cheery and did a good job checking on us.

Murgh Makhani (butter chicken): pretty good. The chicken was soft and not overcooked, but it could have used a little more time in the curry to give it that extra flavor.
Bhindi Masala (sauteed okra): delicious variety of sweetness and spice with a hearty serving of okra.
Garlic/basil naan: Although it's not as fluffy as traditional naan this packs a delicious flavor punch! The oiliness just adds more to the flavor!

We also had an order of Basmati rice which was fine. Portion size was great and I liked how everything was served together - each dish was fresh and hot. The place is on the louder side inside and when we left the place was full. Not a good place for a first date or a romantic evening. Parking on this street is tough to find, so you'll have to look elsewhere or on the side streets.
author: Josh L.

description: I used to order all the time from this place a lot but their delivery guy zoomed at a crazy speed on our cul de sac that was really unsafe given the number of kids on the block that I can't order from this place anymore:( I tried to call and tell someone in the restaurant and no one bothered to listen. I wish management would've taken more interest, given that their delivery guys zooming is a safety issue for the children in the block. Too bad cos many of my neighbors witnessed that delivery guy's car just make a run as though there was a fire and they too don't want to order from this restaurant now.
author: Elizabeth W.

description:
Quick service, and most of what we've tried there has been good.
I definitely recommend the Tandoori Chicken Tikka.
author: Jay M.

description: We have not been here a while but we are glad we are back. The breadbasket is to die for. All the dishes are good. We really enjoyed our dinner. We will be back.
author: Gina M.

description:
Amazing restaurant!!! Great food ! Fabulous service! Chai here reminds me of my home! This restaurant is going into my regulars list. 
Portion sizes are very good! One plate of sabzi is good for two people. Whole wheat roti is soft and big! 
Very reasonable priced restaurant!
I am already Looking forward to my next visit here!
author: Shruti B.

description:
We chose Roti to cater our wedding for a seated, family style meal at our reception venue this year. That were absolutely wonderful during the entire process - meeting in person at the restaurant to go over menu options and do a tasting, setting up rentals (very complicated on our end, and they were so patient with us), and even doing walkthroughs with us at the venue. Everyone at our event loved the food, and several people even told us it was the best wedding dinner they had ever had! Thank you so much to Pankaj, Jay, and their team that were so kind to us through everything. If you're thinking about having Indian food for your event, I'm positive there's no one better in SF to work with!

PS - and if I didn't emphasize it enough, their food is so delicious. We tasted at a few places, and Roti was definitely the best!
author: Shannon M.

description:
Went to this restaurant for dinner for the first time today

We absolutely loved it

The server was very friendly and accommodating, let us order thing off of the menu

We ordered:

Okra Masala - very good
Daal makhani - outstanding
Roti - very good
ALU paratha - ok

Overall a great experience, will definitely go back again
author: Hemant D.

description:
Seeing that my boyfriend and I eat here at least twice a month, I figured it was about time to write them a review.  Roti is a great Indian spot with great service-- including a super friendly and vigilant owner-- awesome menu, and super fresh food.  I didn't use to enjoy Indian food, but Roti perfectly spices their food and it isn't overcooked and oily like I used to find at other Indian spots.  I walk out of Roti feeling energized, rather than in a food coma, and I believe that's a reflection on the quality of their food.  

They have a great seasonal/monthly menu, too, with at least 5-6 unique dishes.  My boyfriend and I usually get one entree off the normal menu and one entree off the seasonal menu because we don't want to miss out on the seasonal (though the normal menu is fantastic).  One item from the seasonal menu that stuck out was a sea bass in a spiced basil cream sauce.  Heaven. 

Last great point: it's a hidden gem.  I can't believe we have this great of an Indian spot in our neighborhood.  Because it's hidden, it's usually easy for the two of us to get a seat when we walk in (I don't think we've ever had to wait for our table).  

So in summary- Roti is great and I highly recommend!
author: Chelsea P.

description: I loved this place.  Comfortable atmosphere.  There's an open kitchen.  Staff are friendly, service is quick.  Shared dinner with a  friend, we ordered chicken korma, chicken tikka masala, rice, and naan.  I also had chai tea.  Everything was delicious.  I hope to go back and try more!
author: I P.

description: Very tasty Indian cuisine. The BEST value for the money. Ambience check. Value check. Taste check. Service check. The owners are very friendly and accessible.
author: Ted G.

description: Nice place with a very friendly waitress (sorry I didn't get your name). I was on a somewhat tense meeting with an acquaintance with some pretty serious conversation. Despite my acquaintance being 30 minutes late the waitress kindly provided drinks and poppadom snacks throughout the wait. Thank you for the top-notch service and sorry for the tense conversations I had to wade through. The food was really nice but somewhat pricey, so one star off there.
author: Roger F.

description:
My sister and I made a last minute decision to come here for lunch since Bursa was closed (and we already paid the parking meter). My only experiences with Indian cuisine were at Naan N Curry, and I found that pretty gross. But I remembered my friend saying this place was good, so I was optimistic.

My sister wasn't too hungry so she ordered the appetizer sampler, while I opted for the Chicken Tikki Masala. When the appetizer sampler came out, I think the food runner forgot to the bring the sauce out with it. After a couple bites, our server offered us the sauces, but handled the situation in a rude way... Anyways, the chicken on my dish was pretty dry. I wasn't a fan of the rice that came with the dish. The grains of rice were super thin, it felt like I was eating nothing. The vegetable salad was good and tasted fresh. Disappointed with the rice, I ordered garlic naan to dip into the sauce of the masala. The garlic naan was pretty good, but when dipped into the sauce, it just tasted like I was eating a pizza.

I think I would've given this place three stars, if it weren't for the flies and the service. During our whole meal, my sister and I kept shooing away flies from our food. They were small fruit flies, and there were a good amount of them. I didn't want to eat my dish anymore because I was scared one of the black peppers could've been a fly. Another table actually smacked one really loudly against the wall.

The server was just really rude from the beginning. After ordering, there was one more menu I forgot to hand her, and she stared at it and  was like, "Um, do you need that?" The menu was within arms reach of her, so I couldn't understand why I needed to hand it over myself. During the time I ordered naan, and after she put it in, she asked, "You just wanted the plain naan , right?" I asked what kind they had, ordered garlic naan, and she just rolled her eyes and looked annoyed cause she had to redo the order. I just don't understand why she didn't ask which one I wanted when I first ordered it... I'm a server myself, so I understand there can be bad days. But there is no reason to be rude to a customer.

I would never come back here... The service can be forgiven since I am a server myself, but there were just so many flies.
author: Derek T.

description: Pretty pricey place given the quality. I got a tikka masala, garlic naan and rice and all of it was pretty bland. Not very flavorful at all. Service is good so I'll give it a 3
author: Jason L.

description: Service was OK, food was average, but the value for the money is not so good, especially considering the alternatives in West Portal. We won't be back, and not because anything was wrong, simply because nothing stood out.
author: Nick S.

description: Roti is a local spot that serves quality Indian food at reasonable prices for the area.  We usually order take out and it always arrives quickly even though they estimate longer waiting times.  The food is piping hot, well packaged, seasoned well, and fresh tasting.   The gentleman who runs the front of the restaurant is a sweet soul and wonderful to encounter on occasion.  He brings a gentle warmth and true desire to engage and ensure customers arrive and leave happy.  Thank you for always doing a great job!
author: Ana W.

description:
Tonight was the first time I have heard my husband utter the words, "This is wonderful" about Indian food. Being Indian himself he holds a standard no restaurant can compete with... Until now.
You can tell a GOOD Indian restaurant by how many Indians eats there. The place was a heady mix and the Indian families were sharing multiple dishes. Another sign was that the masala maintained flavor without tasting sour- something inexperienced Indian chef's seem unable to do. My hubby upped the heat on his Chicken Karahi (a special that day) while I indulged in my favorite- palak paneer. Not gonna lie- I am a palak paneer whore (saag paneer in some places) and I know a good one from a bad one. I scraped the plate clean, it was fantastic. We sided them with raita (decent) and papadum (good) and garlic naan (very good). We would highly recommend a feast or a thali for a sampling of their flavors.

Ironically This post was "Started on 10/27/2012" and somehow went unfinished- Yelp just told me as much. It is 8/25/2016 right now and my husband STILL talks about this restaurant. We have been to dozens and dozens since and THIS one stands out still. That speaks volumes.
author: Julie S.

description: Love this place, love the location and I love the company. There's no waiting time and the food is amazing. Highly recommend it if you love Indian cuisine.
author: DJ Nocturna R.

description: My family and I try to go out to dinner every Friday.  We decided to be adventurous and expand our pallet a bit.  I'm glad we did.  The food was delicious and the staff was very kind to help us choose between the entrees.  Parking can be a bit of a pain but once you're in the door it is a very nice experience.
author: Danielle B.

description: Seriously the best Indian food I've ever had, next to the cooking of either my fiancé or his mother, who are from and still reside in, respectively, Bombay.  The food has been amazing every time I've gone, the service has never disappointed.  In fact, it's great to see the teamwork amongst the staff.  I hope they come to Oakland soon.
author: James R.

description: From the ambience to the service to the food everything was better than expected! My family of 5 which generally seldom agrees on anything all agreed the food was fantastic. The service was attentive, accurate and overall awesome! The Mango lassi was especially a hit and the Basil Naan. We will be back without a doubt the next time we're in town.
author: Chirag G.

description:
Roti is my favorite Indian food in the city. It's great and the owners are fantastic always bringing food over to try and good snacks to have. 

They also deliver if you call their number

My favorite food recommendations:
- lamb korma
- game hen
- veggie pakora
- chai 

Always order rice, mango chutney and raita with everything SOOOO good.
author: Maryam T.

description:
One of the best Indian food joints in the city. Flavors are wonderful, and the service is absolutely fantastic. With monthly specials that introduce fantastic dishes to try along with amazing standards that taste amazing, it's hard to beat Roti. 

I highly recommend the Chicken Korma to folks that normally go for the Chicken Tikka Masala. Put this over their Kashmiri Biryani for a fantastic blend of mild spice with sweet fruit and nuts. Served with a thick Mango Lassi and goat cheese naan? Wow! Oh, and don't forget the Vegetable Pakora to start or their Mixed Green Salad with the spicy dressing. 

But whatever you pick, I don't think you can go wrong. Amazing food and amazing service. 

One note, the restaurant does tend to get loud, as sound seems to be focused into the front with the shape of the ceiling and lack of sound absorbing materials. If you're wanting to have a good conversation at your meal, I suggest you sit near the back and avoid the front by the windows.
author: Stephen H.

description: I just happened to be watching TV when a rerun on local food featured Roti. My wife and I decided to give it a try for our anniversary. It was a great choice. The goat pita bread was amazing. Bonus, if you like heat, ask for the special hot sauce on the side..not for the faint hearted.
author: JR M.

description:
I am not a connoisseur of Indian food. I usually select Indian restaurants based on proximity and/or delivery service. In college I ate several times at a place that was later revealed to be owned by a scoundrel who was hoodwinking women into coming over from India to work as slave labor in his many businesses. In retrospect, the service was lackadaisical, but I thought the food wasn't bad.

That said, Roti serves some of the nicest Indian food I've eaten. It is fresh and unexpected, with offerings that are unfamiliar to readers of takeout menus but still approachable (and very delicious). The meat is tender, the sauces are diverse, and the herbs are fresh. 

As a bonus they are extremely friendly to children, greeting them with a mango lassi upon arrival and usually gracing them with a visit from the manager (or maybe owner?) who arrives bearing tasty little bowls of chutney and the beatific smile of a monk achieving transcendence.
author: Molly O.

description: Tonight I'm very grateful to my partner's advice to go to this old place for a very wonderful dinner.  Old means they are doing so well that they can survive all these years with all competition.  For appetizers, we have the Garlic and Basil Naan, Keema Naan (naan stuffed with grounded lamb) & Fried calamari. Entree we had Tandoori Duck Breast & Keema Aloo Matter .  My favorite is Tandoori Duck Breast. It's only on the December Special menu. The meat is juicy, not over or under cooked, & not greasy at all.   Both Keema dishes are spiced so well that the gamy nature of lamb is minimized.  The fried calamari is distinctively marinated  with Indian spice.  Ambience and service are great.  All is very good here Except the noise level is relatively high inside, may be due to inadequate sound protection.  Must come back soon.
author: Sunny B.

description:
roti is without question the best indian restaurant in sf.  the food is absolutely incredible.  everything is super fresh, high quality and cooked to perfection.  

we had several chicken dishes and all were made with beautiful, clean chicken breast (we do not eat dark meat so this was good for us), the shrimp tandoori was to die for and the saag was lovely.  

the service, staff and atmosphere just adds to the perfection!  highly recommend!
author: Samantha B.

description: One of the best places to have Indian food. Great service, and menu. Must try 'nanini's', and paneer (cottage cheese) dishes. Mango lassi, chai are great too. Owner is always there talking to guest, gives it a nice touch to personalized service! Also, lookout for seasonal specials. Parking might be a struggle, we always try and park on Monterey boulevard, and walk 2-3 blocks.
author: Anisha Y.

description: I have lunch here at least once a week, and the food and service is outstanding.  It is a cute family run business, but what stands out most is how impeccably fresh and authentic the ingredients are in a very clean environment.  Prices are just right and you really can't go wrong with what you order.  I do crave the chicken tikka most, as it comes on a sizzling plate, and it is the best tikka around.  Jay, his wife and father are so kind to me when I come in and can't wait to go back! Yum!
author: Cameron A.

description:
Everything at this place is fabulous! From the food, to the drinks, the wait service, to the owner stopping by to check in, it is all great. 
I have eaten at Roti numerous times and I try to order something different every time. I have never been disappointed. 
The food is reasonably priced and I always leave feeling full with leftovers to enjoy the next day. I love when that happens! This restaurants is one of my favorites in the city. I definitely recommend it to all people, including families.
author: Thea M.

description: Wow, I've never had such bland and uninspiring Indian food. I do live in the East Bay where there are lot of excellent options and this place doesn't come close to any of them. The biggest problem is the food is so underseasoned that it is hard to believe. For example we ordered a vindaloo that was bland... that's right a VINDALOO!!! It appears this place is a favorite of locals and it does have pretensions for being a finer dining establishment, but the main reason I eat Indian food is for flavors and the spice. We did have a decent salmon dish but that didn't make up for how disappointing this meal was. The weirdest thing is this keeps getting recommended to me as being one of the best Indian restaurants in town. All I can say is I'm not believing those people anymore.
author: David H.

description:
What a great find! 

After a bit of research, we went by another Indian restaurant to find that it was closed, and looked like it had been for a while, so we jumped on Yelp to see what else was in the area. Roti looked quite appetising, but with the good reviews and interesting looking menu, we thought it would be fully booked. 

We thought we would check it out anyway and we arrived at about 19:30 to be warmly greeted and offered our choice of tables [from about 5]. Parking was free [after 18:00] and out outside the front window. 

The place was already bustling and the atmosphere was welcoming. The first thing we noticed when we opened the door was the lovely smell, which is a great start. 

We settled in and ordered some drinks [which were topped up throughout - we don't drink much alcohol, so diet coke and sprite were our choices] and then ordered the mixed appetisers [vegetable pakoras, vegetable samosas, popadom, mint raita, and some kind of sweet dipping sauce], mixed bread basket [three types of naan], Murgh Madras, plain rice, and Bhuna Gosht. 

The appetisers came quickly, but not *too* quickly, and we were given plenty of time to enjoy them before the mains came out. A fresh, warm plate was given after the appetiser, in time for the main course. I'm not sure if the warm plates were intentional or if they were just warm out of the washer, but in any case, it was a nice touch. 

The main courses were superb. We're from England and we like our curries spicy, however, these were so tasty [well balanced, delicious flavours] that this didn't matter. However, the owner [??] came and asked us if the meal was spicy enough for us [perhaps the waitress mentioned something to him?] and then brought us over a pot of homemade chilli sauce to add some spice to our meal. The chilli sauce was superb; fresh, very spicy, and plentiful. 

The bread basket was also delicious - we could really taste the ghee, and the garlic naan was a highlight for us. 

All the staff in the restaurant were really lovely, especially our waitress who chatted with us about her travels to England and made us feel very welcomed. We could not have been happier with the service. We were also given a complimentary rice pudding and chai tea at the end of our meal. 

We're so pleased that we happened across this place, and hopefully, on one of our future trips to San Francisco, we will return. 

Thank you Roti!
author: Lindsey B.

description:
A friend who bought the living social deal for this place invited me to dinner with a bunch of friends. I've been curious about the place for a while since I keep passing it whenever I'm on the M so I was excited.

The place is pretty nice inside and the service is really friendly and attentive. We were seated fairly quickly. 

I ordered the mango lassi ($5) and the Tandoori game hen ($17). Everyone else got the Indian lemonade ($3), chai tea ($3 and refillable), dal gosht ($17), chicken tikka masala ($16?), and lamb curry ($16?). We shared a large serving of rice (?) and a naan basket ($10). 

Mango lassi is delicious and refreshing. I recommend. It cuts into the spiciness of the Indian food. Lemonade is good too, but the saltiness can be off-putting for some. They offer to have you try it before you order it. Chai is okay. Pretty bland until you add their house sugar cubes which have more spices in them.
