9th and Irving and West Portal are equal distance for me but when I'm too lazy to circle for parking I choose West Portal.  In the future if I am feeling like Indian and am in West Portal I think I'll stick to India Clay Oven (much more authentic and delicious).
author: Lisa C.

description: Had a perfect dinner experience! My husband and I needed to get to a movie next door in 20 mins, and the server said no problem! Food was out quickly- it was delicious (Saag Paneer and a curry) - we were on our way. Flawless. On our way out, the hostess offered to keep our leftovers in their refrigerator while we were at the movie! Above and beyond. So nice.
author: Emily B.

description: I was very impressed...walked in off the street on New Year's Eve hoping to grab a spot and they were very accommodating...owner was very nice....food was fantastic...had the lamb popsicles which were basically tandoori lamb chops...the naan was very good, as was the draft beer selection...my only complaint was the curries were a little watery but the flavor was top notch...would definitely come back...entrees were pretty big for the price
author: Theodore N.

description:
Located in the slightly upscale West Portal area, this restaurant is a trendy upscale version of Indian cuisine that's been elevated by quality ingredients and tailored for American palates.  It has a great atmosphere and would be great place to take a date.

Tried out this restaurant on a Friday night around 730 PM and the restaurant was bustling with a full crowd.  Reservations are recommended to ensure your seat without a small wait.

Service was excellent and attentive throughout the night.

Our party of 3 ordered:
 Murgh Makhani -boneless tandoori chicken cooked in mild spices, tomatoes, butter and cream 
Roti's Rogan Josh - classic lamb curry with garlic, ginger, peppercorns, onions and saffron
 Mixed Seafood Biryani - fresh fish, prawns and calamari cooked with basmati rice, saffron, butter and fresh herbs 
Goat Cheese Naan - Warm fresh buttery naan topped with a goat cheese blend as an appetizer.
Tandoori Roti - Soft roti bread that paired well wtih our entrees

All of the dishes were very flavorful, and while not spicy to the taste, were chock full of spices that will give you the Indian cuisine experience.  The dishes were very mild and catered to a more Americanized palate.

The owner stopped by near the end of the meal and had a nice chat about the ingredients and the ambiance.  Definitely recommended if you're craving a new dining experience and want to venture out for Indian food.
author: Henry L.

description:
I love curry so much!!
I'm from England, and my Dad came to stay in SF and fancied a curry, and I found this place on yelp, and we have never looked back!!
It's honestly one of the best curries I've had in my life; the Korma is chicken, lamb or veg is to die for!!
And the goats cheese naan is delicious!!
The manager always remembers us which is so nice, and often brings over free poppadums!
It's a little pricey, but worth every penny, and the portions are easily sharable between 2.
We've already decided Roti will be our last meal out in SF! love it!
author: Ellie S.

description:
as another yelper sed this is the grown up Naan Curry!!!

majority of all dishes we ordered had heat, except for the naan, I'm not a fan of hot food but this place makes you want to take bite after bite after bite even though you can no longer feel your tongue and your lips start to swell haha, it is really that good.

chicken tikka masala not spicy, sauce hearty literally hearty as hell, chicken chunks are proportioned and can be cut up into 3 small pieces and each piece was juicy and not dry

gosht biryani - each bite flavorul and lamb slices large in size similar to the chicken tikki masala in regards to size of meat, this place gives you far amount of meat over the rice, not like most places where there is 90% rice and 10% meat the serving here is more like 60% rice and 40% meat, and it packs heat after your 4th bite you will notice a lil sweat beat forming on the top of you head

shakooti lamb - peppered lamb in a brownish reddish curry take the heat meter up another notch with this plate you can see the black peppers and smell the hear lingering through your sense as you wait for the plate to drop so you can get some on your plate directly into your mouth haha

garlic & basil naan - not like naan curry's but good just the same, alot thinner but the flavor is all there, dip it in with the tikka masala sauce if not the shakooti lamb sauce for a more full flavored effect

the cucumber raita was also ordered to take the heat down to some effect, lil salty yogurt with cucumber, caraway and cumin put this on top of your naan, your shakooti lamb, or biryani to ease the heat you probably already have while eating here at Roti

food ****
price $$ lil pricey but food is excellent
service ***** my cup of water never hit the bottom it was always refilled, asked for recommendations from the waiter she was dead on about the gosht biryani and the cucumber raita 
ambiance **** very modern restaurant, dark hard wood, lil dark in the inside, pictures from india on the walls

parking = ( it is in the city kinda, west portal so parking can become difficult if you heading out during prime times, try to carpool if you can
author: Clarence A.

description: I have been to many Indian Bistros and I have to say Roti is on my top 10 list.  Authentic food with open kitchen floor plan so you can go see what they are cooking and everything is fresh.  I mainly eat organic foods and this place has tons of choices.  The food was amazing, the perfect amount of spice and flavor, the manager was very friendly and gave us a great experience.  Will definitely go back and see them soon!!!
author: David K.

description:
The Chicken Tikka Masala is beyond excellent!  The atmosphere is cozy as well as eclectic.

Wait staff is professinal, knowlegable and personable.

It is a great place for families as well as a place to meet friends for a fun meal.
author: Marian H.

description:
The service was amazing. 

Our waiter was friendly, attentive and did a great job! The manager checked on us and so did the owner. The service was quick and they fit us in even though it was pretty full...

The food was excellent! All of the complex flavors that I love in Indian food. One dish was super hot!!! Sometimes it's hard to find spicy food in restaurants... even when the menu says it's hot. 

The atmoshpere was sophisticated and comfortable. I highly recommend that you try it! Easy parking!!!

This is the spicy dish that I ordred:

Tandoori Scallops 
Large sea scallops and baby potatoes are marinated in a spicy mix of minced fresh ginger & garlic, finely ground chili pepper, turmeric, crushed black pepper & salt, fresh lemon juice and olive oil. The scallops are skewered with the baby potatoes, roasted over the mesquite charcoal of the tandoor and slipped onto a sizzling platter for serving.

Rosemary Naan
Roti's delicious unleavened bread baked fresh in the tandoor with the savory herbed flavor of rosemary. The perfect compliment to many of Roti's curry dishes.

Both were SUPER yummy!!!!
author: Kimberly R.

description:
My adviser organized a lab party here for 15 people, and made lunch reservations. Turned out the reservation was unnecessary. At 1pm on a weekday the place was completely empty. Obviously it's been this way for awhile, because they only had one waitress working. This left us a little concerned about what we'd gotten into, but the waitress worked her butt off and was fantastic. Our chai mugs were always full, and our food was brought out quickly.

My boyfriend was sad that the lunch menu didn't offer more curry options, but ended up ordering the Naanini (which many of us got as well). One pleasant surprise was how large the portions were, and for an average of $10! However, we expected the Naanini  to be served with the mint chutney sauce on the side, but the sauce was actually baked into the lamb, which made the dish very dry. Combine this with the naan and you have a huge portion that is basically impossible to finish. 

I did look at the dinner menu and it seemed very expensive, so many the portions are even larger and worth splitting? Overall I thought the food was alright and the service was good, but it still sort of spooked me that it was so empty!
author: Rachel A.

description:
New to the neighborhood, we decided to try Roti Indian Bistro on West Portal...and we loved it!  The food was very delicious and the portions were so big, we had to take some home (enough for a second meal!).  

But what makes Roti so special is the personal attention paid by the owner to each and every customer...he took the time to come by our table several times to make sure we had everything as ordered, he treated us to complimentary desserts, and even gave us some authentic curry spices to take home to try with our cooking.  

When a person loves what s/he is doing, it shows...this is a family restaurant and the owners take pride in the food and service they provide...we will be going there often!
author: Ed K.

description: I don't know what's happened to the service since the last I dined there, but it really sucked last night.  We made a reservation through open table since it was my brothers birthday. I put instructions on the reservation to please have a piece of birthday cake brought out after dinner was over. By the time our dinner was over(8:30), we had to consistently flag over our waiter to get the table cleared. They were all gathered in the back and looked like they were ready to go home. The cake was supposed to be a surprise but I couldn't very well ask the waiter in front of my brother  "where's the cake?"- so we left after paying our bill and I'm not so sure I want to go back there with so many great Indian places in the Bay Area that does have the combination of great food and service
author: Roger B.

description:
Amazing food and service. Locally sourced ingredients. Reasonably priced wine list and the food prices are moderate.  Not your typical "cheap" indian place but thats ok. Indian food can be elevated.

Is it as chic as Amber India? No, but that isn't what they are trying to do. This is a nice neighborhood restaurant that serves quality food.
author: Eric T.

description:
Excellent service!  After walking through West Portal we decided to choose Roti in the midst of other delicious looking establishments within the vicinity.  I was raised in West Portal but live in Seattle now, yet I have never tried the "new" and what geriatric WP residents would call "hip" restaurants in the area. I expected a westernized bland approach to indian food, and while yes, it was a bit mild, by no means was it flavorless. 

We were promptly seated and while the waitress seemed to be phasing out and we had no idea who our server was,  the transition was fluid and service was not compromised. We ordered the grilled lamb with mixed bell peppers and red onion, the cauliflower potato curry special, naan and basmati rice.  Complimentary chip crisps the size of tortillas with dipping sauces prior to our meal.  When we asked for extra yogurt sauce, the young male server came out with a much bigger bowl. Yes! Extra sauce in a bowl bigger than a ramekin! The bussers were efficient and quick, and the owner seemed to be in house.  

All in all, I was pleased with the service, and pleasantly full.  This is not the hip hole in the wall I typically frequent, but it was merely some old fashioned family owned restaurant trying to please the white mans taste buds... And they were doing it damn well.
author: Cat A.

description:
This is/was/will always be my favorite Indian food restaurant. This is the place that made me fall in love with Indian food in the first place. When I lived in SF, this is where I would go as a special treat--and that's exactly what it is.

It's quaint (it's in West Portal after all) and cute and the food and service have always been outstanding. 

Mmm...my mouth waters when I think about it. Goat cheese naan, chicken korma and vindaloo...it doesn't get any better!
author: Amy H.

description: Best Tandoori Chicken I've had in SF...hands down.  And despite a full dining room, the staff was calm, friendly, and interested in our satisfaction.  Huge fan of this place.
author: Kurt L.

description: Fantastic Paneer dish with red sauce, incredible. Proprietor came over to check on us. Service great. Grilled tandoor seafood out of this world.
author: Ronnie D.

description:
Food was okay. I have high expectations for naan-- I felt like the frozen one at Trader Joe's is better than this. Maybe because it was a bit burnt. I enjoyed the chicken tikka masala, as well as the tandoori mixed dish that consists of lamb, chicken, fish (salmon) and vegetables. Some of the curries are very spicy so watch what you order. 

I was not a fan of the dessert, although the Mango Lassi (mango & yogurt) drink was okay. The dumplings were strange to me, and the rice pudding was more watery than pudding consistency--but hey, maybe that's how it's supposed to be, but not my taste.

Overall atmosphere was nice and clean. Service was attentive.
author: Allyson L.

description: We recently went back when we bought a coupon off of livingsocial...$25 for $50. Totally worth it!!! Well, it looks like they rose their prices. Tikka masala is now $16 and the portion is small with very little chicken. I still love this place and I think the food is excellent but indian food for $80 for 2 is a tad pushing it.
author: Michelle I.

description:
Delish.  Great service.  Friendly.  Fast.  Wonderful. 

We ordered everything off of the specials menu.  Rosemary naan, Tandoori Game Hen, Black eye peas & mushroom curry.  Absolutely wonderful.  I could eat this same  meal every night.  

The waiter let us know that they are planning to  start delivery in the next few weeks, and they may begin setting aside some reserved parking out front.  I can't wait. 

We will definitely come back.
author: Brianna C.

description:
The food is really good.  When you walk in, you're not sure whether the food will be good, but it's really good.  Well appointed Indian restaurants sometimes skimp on food quantity and spiciness, but the portion sizes are right, and the food is really good.

And where else will they not mind that you're sitting around taking up space while catching up for two hours with people you used to work with at a crazy crazy job that no one should have to work?
author: John S.

description: This is my favorite Indian restaurant in West Portal!! My favorite dish is their Paneer makhani which I order in couple of times a month. Recently I went there with a group of friends and the owner there was very thoughtful. We ordered a pakora appetizer and an assorted appetizer plate which also had pakoras. He removed the pakoras from their assorted platter and gave us extra samosas instead which we really appreciated!! Also, they have a fixed menu and an special menu which changes every month giving the regulars a change every so often :)
author: Amrit B.

description:
I'm not sure if the owners who took over a couple years ago actually read these reviews, but the common thread here is people think this USED to be a great place to have dinner, and now it is NOT...They might consider calling in Gordon Ramsey to see how they can save this place. We used to be loyal customers going as often as twice weekly. NO MORE. Not worth the price, the trip or the calories...The only thing still worth my crave at this place is the Goat Cheese Naan. Other than that i can't think of a reason to go here...
Prices are up, food portions and quality way down...
 staff also aren't what they used to be. We have found better Indian food and much kinder staff elsewhere. While i will say they still make a great chicken tikka massala and goat cheese naan. It's really the only draw this place has any
author: Johnny G.

description:
This Indian restaurant is okaaaay. It's americanized Indian. Go down the street to Indian clay oven restaurant; it's way better and surprisingly cheaper. Indian clay oven is where you'll find more Indian people dining :)

On the up side, the service is great and when you walk down the hall you can see the kitchen which I always like.
author: Kortni S.

description: Food is amazing, and service is even better. The owner is almost always here and takes very good care of every table. Great experience overall, highly recommend!!!
author: K P.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place for a while, so when the living social deal came around I went ahead and bought here.

Went here with my husband on a Saturday night, we made a reservation online (via opentable), was glad we did as the place was really busy, not sure if this is the norm on a Saturday night or just because of the living social deal, as I saw a few people with the coupon. 

I have been to the Roti in Burlingame and really enjoyed it and this was just as good. Service was very quick and friendly, although they did bring us the wrong appetizer, but that was quickly fixed.

One of my bug bears is water, I hate having to ask to get my glass refilled, they were a little slow on this front, but they were very busy and when they noticed my glass was empty they were very apologetic.

My husband and I both enjoyed our meals: mixed appetizers, chicken korma, lamb madras, garlic naan and goats cheese naan.

Would definitely go back again (just wish parking in WP was easier!!)
author: sarah s.

description: Roti is charming: attractive, tidy, friendly staff, gracious owner and some of the best Indian cuisine around.  Have had many dishes, familiar and not so familiar and never have had a bad meal. The flavors linger after you have left the restaurant.
author: Erica C.

description:
I always considered Indian food, for a change. After going "veg" the last few weeks, my taste is for lighter fare.
Roti offers an impressive list  of vegetarian dining from simple to complex.

The medley of summer vegetable curry was a splendid mix of temperatures and spices. My wife had the tikka masala -- sauce just the right sort of velvety texture.
author: eric s.

description:
I used to love this place. 
What happened?
Service was the main thing missing.  
We ordered a bottle of wine.  It came to the table already opened, was poured quickly without a taste and was not even the bottle we ordered.  I can live with not tasting a wine first, it's a casual place, but bringing a bottle already opened? And it's not what I ordered?  Seriously? 

So we order another one.  He comes to the table and starts to open it.  Not what we ordered.  Really.  What a way to start the meal.

He brings the appetizer and we have maybe taken a bite and he comes over to get the dinner order.  

Dear Roti, if you have a head waiter, he's off his game.  These guys are on the floor and making rookie mistakes.  Roti is not cheap.  And you don't start a meal like that.  Wowsa. 

Food was ok.  Not quite as yummy as I remember but good.  

Not sure I'll be back, and that makes me sad.  :(
author: amy b.

description:
OMGOSH!!! I love this place soooo much! Now, my experience may be AWESOME becuase during the time of me entering the door and sitting down there was only one other party and I! I wouldn't know exactly how this would differ if there were more people in this restaurant. 

First things first. The service was awesome! But what do you expect having just yourself and another party.

Second, the quality of the food was excellent!

Third, I loved the decor, it was very modern yet it had some kind of cultural roots in it, i'm assuming. 

Fourth, the price was decent. 

And lastly, putting everything together this experience was fantastic!!! It's a perfect "get away" from it all. A perfect time for intimate moments, fun laughs, and perhaps even business meetings. 

Oh yea... The waiters were cute! Can I take one of your waiters to go with me too? hehe.
author: Ronnel C.

description:
My favorite Indian place in the City, admittedly I still have many to try. 

Goat cheese naan is delicious. The murgh mahkani (I think I'm spelling that right) is amazing. Just the right amount of spice.

Both times I went the service was great. They're not afraid to recommend dishes and they have great recommendations!
author: Brendan B.

description: I really enjoy Indian food, Roti is delicious. My only complaint is the steep price. Otherwise, if you are not big into spicy, get mild.
author: C B.

description:
Real rating: 2.5 stars.
I am not a big Indian food fan as some of the spices just don't seem to agree with me, but a few colleagues wanted Indian so off we go. 6 of us went for lunch on a weekday at 12 noon. Roti was not crowded for lunch. Place is very nicely decorated and seemed very clean and well mannered. We ordered the mixed tandoori plate, a lamb curry, an eggplant curry, mixed bread plate (with Roti and Naan), saffron rice, mango chutney, and a cucumber yogurt. We also grabbed some Indian lemonade. 

The Tandoori plate was cooked well, good but not great flavor. The lamb curry was very spicy but had nice flavor. The eggplant curry was everyone's favorite- tender but not mushy. Nice mouth feel and spice. My favorites were the basics; I thought the rice was very good and the Naan was excellent. I also really loved the Indian lemonade- think lemonade with some mint and herbs. 

However I need to deduct a half star for each point below:
1) curries were too spicy for some of our party. Server never asked or consulted us on our spicy comfort level. Place was not crowded so I think there should have been better dialogue.
2) Prices are high, portions are small. Considering your basic entree is between $14-$20 and you have to order rice and accompaniments 
extra, the bill adds up. 
3) Tagging onto the above, we noticed that another customer ordered a plate that seemed to have an entree, rice and naan on it. We asked what it was and was told by the waiter that it was a combo special from their lunch specials menu, which he said he didn't give us since he figured we would order entrees together 'family style'. This really didn't sit well with me - I thought it was totally unprofessional - next time let the customer decide, not you!

So Roti on food alone would have earned 4 stars, but instead only 2.5 stars for overall performance.
author: Dom L.

description:
Last week C, her father and I took granny of 86 years out to eat at Roti. C's dad found it based on the reviews and thought it a good choice not too far from Golden Gate Park. We had just taken in an afternoon of Picasso at the De Young and needed sustenance before the drive back to Santa Cruz.

When we arrived we were greeted by a friendly server and were offered the booth in the window. After discussions of how tasty the menu looked and there were so many options to choose from, we shared a couple of Roti feasts, samosas (delicious) and the house favorite curry which had chicken and tomato cream sauce (TDF). The small but well chosen beer list were great pairings with the flavorful rich meal. The Roti feast really gives a great sampling of all the quality plates Roti can offer, especially the tandoori lamb. We scarfed up every last lentil and scoop of rice which impressed the owner enough to offer Bday girl Granny a spectacular dessert of rice pudding. Loved it.

The service was attentive and knowledgeable thanks to our waiter John and the owner was completely gracious and thoughtful. I am already planning my return trip!
author: Nathaniel M.

description: I can see why there is often a line at this place.  Came for lunch one day.  I got there about 11:15 and there were only about 5 ppl ahead of me in line. The line moved quick.  The food was very tasty, and well priced.  There was too much food for myself for lunch, but it was good!
author: Sarah F.

description: So happy we decided to try this place tonight!  It has become my new favorite Indian restaurant!  The food was delicious, flavorful, fresh, and just plain perfect.  From the lentils to tikka masala, to the roti and chutney....wow!  The waitstaff was very nice and it is always nice to see the manager checking on all of the guests.  I can't wait to go again! Our experience was truly wonderful!
author: Isla B.

description: Had dinner here today.  Very good service and very tasty food.  The tandoori duck was very tender, the lamb korma very creamy and the cherry naan delicate and sweet.
author: Duncan R.

description:
I finally got the chance to go to Roti. My Indian friends didn't recommend it because they said it is not worth the price. They were right. We ordered chicken, naan, rice. As the previous reviewer mentioned; the restaurant is nicely decorated but it can not compete with the food at Naan & Curry or India Clay Oven. 

What bothered me the most was that some waiters in the back were talking shit about customers. If you have an open kitchen, that is really rude and unprofessional especially if customers are paying $15 for a meal that is 100 times better elsewhere... 

Not recommended! Go to Naan & Curry on Van Ness instead. You are paying $ 9.99 for an awesome buffet that is totally worth it.
author: MS K.

description:
I went here about 6 weeks ago with family and friends. Decided to check this place out and decided to test my stomach out on some new food. My body itself is very sensitive to certain foods especially Indian Food, but i decided to risk it! The meals and appetizers are amazing and have their own style to it! My favorite dish was the roasted coliflower head with some sort of spice and sauce on it. It was much bigger than i imagined, and it was certainly delicious. No stomach problems! whoo-hoo!

I also had Indian Lemonade. It was certainly interesting, definately trying new things, but wasnt something i would have again. Its a mix of sour, sweet and salty. The color is interesting, and they add fresh leaves of mint throughout the glass.

Good restuarant, could be pricey, but was very good.
author: Cody A.

description: Delicious!  The naan bread was outstanding and all the dishes were excellent.  Plus great service!  I would highly recommend this place!
author: Niki Y.

description: Really amazing food. We got the chicken tikka masala, tandoori duck and chicken korma, all of which were perfectly seasoned and delish! Highly recommend
author: Lauren R.

description:
I live in West P and go to Roti Bistro at least every couple of months.  The food has always been delicious, and the service is always attentive and nice.  I've taken a number of friends and they are always very impressed   

The owner always does something extra special (free mango drinks for the kids, free app while you're waiting for the rest of your party, etc.).  Truly a great place!
author: Lyn R.

description:
I make no claims to be any sort of expert in authenticity. I do, however, believe I know a bit about what tastes good. And Roti tastes GOOD! After fetching my favorite Washingtonian at the airport last week he mentioned Indian food and suspecting he'd never seen West Portal I figured Roti might be a good detour on our way home. We ordered the assorted appetizers (samosas, pakoras and pappadum), chicken tikka masala, saag aloo, rice and naan. We thoroughly enjoyed all of the food and were particularly impressed with the quality of the cucumber raita. 

I've rarely, if ever, had the chance to have Indian food in such a beautiful, modern setting. Authentic or not, the food here is delicious and I look forward to returning!
author: Miriam W.

description:
Had dinner here Fri night on a fun night of barhopping with Catherine C who was up visiting from LA.

Upon the advice of the waiter, we ordered a bottle of Argentinian malbec called Dona something...I think Dona Caldo.  It was most characteristically a malbec and had a bit of an edge on first taste, but mellowed nicely after it sat a bit and went well with the spicy food.  BTW, that waiterperson we had, the tall guy with the tats was really cool.

The samosas we ordered as an appetizer were good and surprisingly big, although I thought them a bit bland.  I thought the ones I've had at Dosa Fillmore were smaller, but a lot more flavorful.

What really did it for me was the Lamb Korma.  As I've grown older, I've become allergic to cashews so I had it with sliced almonds instead, but wow, the cream-based curry was wonderful.  Just couldn't get enough of it and I found myself dipping the naan into it just to have more after my lamb ran out. 

Catherine ordered a vegetarian dish that I can't seem to remember the name of which was also good (sorry, it was a fun night!), but the Lamb Korma is what really did it for me.  The lamb was a touch dry, but I loved the flavor profile of the curry.  I definitely want to go back to try it again soon.

Didn't have any dessert since we were still barhopping...places to go, drinks to be drunk.

Nice upscale modern Indian food in pleasant surroundings...one of the better places to in the area, that's for sure.  Seating without reservations on a Friday night was pretty easy too although I think our timing was just right.  Always wanted to try this place and I'm glad I finally did.
author: Roy N.

description:
Incredibly nice people, and wonderful food.  Yes, it is significantly more expensive than other Indian places but I firmly believe this is a case of getting what you pay for.

I love their monthly specials - the salads are fantastic.  None of the anemic tomatos and iceberg lettuce you find at many other Indian places.  Instead, creative combos like arugula with goat gouda, pomegranate, pistachios, and a spicy cumin-coriander dressing.  

Their buttery paratha is wonderful, and my tandoori game hen I had last night was unbelievably tasty - so juicy and succulent.  They're clearly using quality ingredients.

My husband is a conisseur of chicken tikka masala (he once ate it every day for a month) and he thinks theirs is some of the best around.

Portions are large so you can easily get two meals out of a salad and an entree.  
It seems to quiet down in there pretty early - we came in at 9pm and there were only two other tables with people at them.  By the time we finished we were the only people there, but the staff never made us feel rushed.

After having three great meals here over the last couple years, I can say without hesitation that this is my favorite Indian restaurant in San Francisco.
author: C S.

description: Best Indian in the city I've had so far. The waitress was able to make a lot of good suggestions and was very courteous. The food was extremely good. Loved every dish we got. Definitely going back for more.
author: Michael S.

description:
I think "Indian Bistro" is code for Indian without buffet.  That's right, this is not the all-you-can-eat kind of Indian joint.  Ambience is modern yet cozy, kind of like the way I would decorate my house if I actually owned it.  Interestingly, that makes you feel more like you're in a posh suburb than West "50's time-warp" Portal.  But then, at its heart, West Portal pretty much is a posh suburb.

Anyhow, we got several dishes to share, but the real standouts were the Vegetarian Korma and the bread basket...slap a dollop of on onto a slice of the other, and it melts in your mouth.  Agreed, this is not particularly authentic tasting (not very spicy for one), but it strikes a beautiful balance between elegant bistro fare and comfort food.  Plus, they gave us complimentary port for dessert (I notice they're really trying to push the wine & dessert selection here).

Now if only these dishes came with single-digit prices, this would be 5 stars all the way.
author: Wes M.

description:
Garlic and Basil Naan
Roti's Basmati Pulao
& of COURSE.....Chicken Tikka Masala


that's it that's all for two. delicious. $40 . you will feel like royalty. YUM.
author: Emerald I.

description:
Horrible service and only decent food. 

I went here for lunch with my fiancé and after walking down West Portal we figured some Indian food would be a good change from the regular sandwiches/salads we have for lunch most days.  We were the first people to arrive and be seated for the lunch service and after waiting for over an hour to receive our entree, I had to ask the waitress to package out food to go because my fiancé's lunch break was far over.  The kicker is that while we were the first people there, we were the last out of six other tables, which were seated after us, to receive our food.  Compounding their failure is that we ordered off of their lunch special menu which are plates that are designed to be able to expedited quickly to the table!  The one saving grace was that our server was polite but all the other glaring shortfalls are hard to over look.

Ultimately, I will never return here.
author: Adam S.

description:
I love you goat cheese Naan. With your warm, gooey goat cheese middle, and your cold fresh goat cheese to spread on the outside. You make me happy. Almost as happy as the Lamb Korma, but when I combined the two of you, it was a match made for my tummy...and my tummy was happy.
 Oh yes, the veggie samosas for the appetizer certainly hit the spot, along with the glass of  riesling from their limited though Indian cuisine friendly wine list. 
Indeed, the only reason all this happy food did not give the place five stars was the noise level. If I had to hear the lady across the room cackle one more time, I swear my goat cheese naan was gonna get up and do mean and unusual things to her purse. So a bit too loud to relax fully to enjoy this happy happy food...perchance next time I will order take out, and me and my beloved goat cheese naan can be reunited again and all will be happy again.
author: Danielle L.

description:
The ambiance is very nice. It's a good place to take a date who has never had Indian food before. It's like Fisher Price "My First Indian Meal."

They focus on the tandoor. For that, I have to say it's not terrible. The naan is also edible--about like Trader Joe's frozen naan quality. The curries, especially the meat curries, are pretty poorly done. Flavorless, spice-less, yet greasy and heavy. Service is on the poor side. 

Worst of all it's highway robbery. The prices are about three times what they should be. The profit margin here is absolutely shameless. You can easily find better Indian food, regardless of price. Not recommended.
author: Jeff K.

description: Yum. Great cauliflower and tikka masala. Service was great. You can tell the owner really enjoys being a restauranteur. I particularily liked seeing him interact respectfully with the kitchen staff.
author: Omar M.

description:
My fiancee and I live in San Jose where there are a lot in north Indian restaurants which are pretty good but none of them are anything close to Roti. We go up to San Francisco regularly to go here.

The malai chicken, game hen, aloo gobi, palak paneer, tandoori seafood platter, butter chicken are all AWESOME!! And they go great with the selection of naan that they have. The garlic basil naan and goat cheese naan are especially innovative since I haven't even eaten them in India.

Every month they have specials and what I really like about them is that they fuse styles and use a lot of seafood in their preparations which normally indian restaurants  neglect.

If you're anywhere in the area I would highly recommend trying it out if you haven't. It is the perfect place to try out Indian food for the first time or if you're a regular its a great place to experience new flavors.  

P.S: The service here is definitely close to the best I've seen in the bay area.
author: Natalie G.

description:
I've always wanted to try this place and finally got my chance a few weeks ago.  I'm not a die hard on Indian food but was feeling the craving for a few basic Indian classics.  Came on a Sunday night around 5:30 and the place started jumping from 6pm on.  The service looked a little stretched as they didn''t seem to have a designated host.  I guess my puzzled look was enough for one of the waiters to notice us and he quickly seated us and apologized.  The place gets cold but they had little space heaters above the booths to combat the draft...creative, yet ghetto.

The food is decent and they kept the water filled, which is necessary if you can't take the heat.  I learned to ask how spicy their dishes were at baseline before they added more spice.  The naan and tandoori roti were as good as I expected and we enjoyed flavorful & cripsy chicken pakoras as appetizers.  The eggplant curry was definitely on the bland side and overspiced, but the chicken tikka masala, gosht madras (lamb), and Aloo Gobi (cauliflower) were all excellent dishes and worth trying.  There are enough strong classic dishes, ambiance and some eye catching art that will keep me a fan of this place.
author: Darren B.

description:
So I've been back a couple of times in the last month, and both times service (specifically, time management) has been terrible. On one occasion I called to order take out, and they said it would be ready in "fifteen minutes". I arrived half an hour later, and to make a long story short, I had to wait another 20 minutes. Someone even had the nerve to come and tell me that "after my call they got a lot of sitting customers" so our order was bumped. What??

Then today I took my mom who's visiting from out of town because she wanted Indian. We fed the meter one block away 1 hour (the limit), went in, ordered from their lunch menu, and it took them pretty much half an hour to produce the plates. We ate in a hurry, got back to the car to find the meter expired and a traffic cop approaching; I missed getting a ticket by literally a few seconds.

Don't ever go there unless you have time (and money) to burn; there are a lot of better Indian places that are less expensive and more efficient.
author: Jesse G.

description:
We went here the other night and left very disappointed.  The waiter was unfriendly and could barely make a sentence.  For half of our meal, he sat in the last table and had a LOUD cell phone conversation - this place deserves NO STARS just for this alone.

A year ago this place would have been packed.  It was eerily empty when we were there.  

The food was forgettable.  We ordered the veggie combo plate for two.  I enjoyed the eggplant dish but the veggies were just sort of greasy and tasteless (aloo gobi would have been a better choice).
author: M K.

description:
I have wanted to try Roti for some time.  I grew up in West Portal and spend a lot of time in that neighborhood to this day.  My sister and I were waiting to eat at another restaurant Saturday night.  We had about a 30 minute wait and we were sitting outside waiting to be called.  I spotted Roti and knew I had wanted to try it for a long time.  I ran across the street to ask about a table.  It was a busy Saturday night on West Portal.  The hostess said it would be about 20 minutes.  She took my cell number and said she would call me when a table opened up.  I went back outside and just as I crossed the street she had come running over to tell us the table was ready!  

We ended up having the best meal.  I had the Lamb Biryani.  It was flavorful, tender and some yummy!  Indian comfort food.  My sister had prawns that she loved, they were spicy and succulent.  We shared a huge order of the Basil and Garlic naan.  Everything was perfect.  They even had 21st Amendment beer on the menu.  A dream come true!  

It was my niece's B-day and the owner brought 2 scoops of Mitchell's ice cream over with a candle in it for her.  She is only 2 but was delighted and ate every drop of her chocolate ice cream.  Mitchell's is the best in the city....I love that this restaurant serves local favorites as well.  The service was top notch.  Everyone was friendly and accommodating.  They worked very hard to make our night enjoyable and the food was delicious!  I will be back!!
author: Cynthia S.

description:
Terrible service, terrible food and lackluster performance all around. 

Don't go with a large party if you want your food to arrive on time, or at all for that matter. An hour dinner will take four. 

Management doesn't care about their patron. 

Don't waste your money on this joint.
author: Simone L.

description: I ate here with my husband and sister in law a few weeks ago.  Our food was delicious, the atmosphere was beautiful and the service was great.  We ate the Chicken Tikka Masala, a lamb & rice dish and one of the specials. Yum!
author: Christy L.

description:
Came here for a Birthday dinner and the food was just So-so.  Small portions and the flavor -- nah....nothing special for the prices they charged.  The naan was a bit burnt and we waited quite a bit for our food w/ no bread, nothing to at least munch on...

also, not a good place for kids AT ALL. There is nothing on the menu that is non-spicy.  And as we learned, all the sauces are pre-prepared so you don't have a choice of making any dish non-spicy or spicier to fit your taste.   Normally, in most of the other Indian restaurants we go to, we get to tell the waitress whether we want it mild, or spicier, etc.  Nope, not here.
author: Jannie Q.

description:
Definitely one of my favorite restaurants!!!  Where do I start... well, this fun, lively neighborhood Indian restaurant located on West Portal is a great place to go with a group of 3+ and enjoy a family style shared meal.  I think its best like this so you can try a little bit of many different plates together...  my recommendation to try - naan bread is amazing especially   when eaten and dipped in all the flavorful foods and sauces!  Kabuli naan
is my choice as it is coated on the inside with pure sweetness (raisins, nuts and cherries).   Try the  vegetable samosas,chicken Vindaloo or  tikka , along with any of the rice entrees and enjoy this all together with an order of  palak paneer (spinach with cheese and spices) for a winning combination!!  All these spices and flavor always seems to make me very satisfied and hyper!!!  Can't wait to eat here again!
author: Jessica C.

description:
So I've been here twice with one of my friends back in the days before college. Every time we get back in touch with each other and we want to eat out, it's usually here. She really loves this jackfruit rice dish that they serve. I have to admit that it's pretty good. Personally, I love the naan that they make here. Then again, I'm a naan fiend. The chicken tikka masala is also very good.

I'd normally give this a four-star rating... maybe even a five... but I have one major problem with this place, and for me it's a common trend with places like these... it's just too expensive for what they serve. Now, I prefer quality over quantity for sure, but I'm not a big fan of places that overcharge their food just because they look all fancy on the inside. I feel that this place is more catered towed the upper-middle class that get suckered into a place like this because it looks fancy and the food is pretty decent and because they charge so much, it must be good, right?

I just don't buy into fancy facades... most of the time.

You can get a better deal on 9th and Irving, or other places in the City. Sure, you might be entering a hole-in-the-wall or a place that doesn't look so fancy, but you just get better deals, for food that's just as good, if not maybe a small step below in quality.

If I went on a first date, hypothetically, and she was into the whole hoity-toity restaurant scene where they overprice their food because their place looks all sleek and hip, I'd take her here... well, if she wanted to eat Indian, that is. Realistically, I'm just not into that scene, or people who are like that. I'd rather go to Naan N Curry instead. The food at Roti is good and all, but to me, it's not really worth the price.
author: Chris S.

description:
We have eaten at dozens of Indian places in 8 cities, and this one is our favorite, hands down.

The meats/fish are tender and flavorful, the curries are sumptuous.  The Naan and rice dishes are done perfectly.  Each dish is a work of art.

Service is excellent.  The owner goes out of his way to may his customers happy and to make them feel appreciated.

This is one of our favorite SF restaurants overall.
author: Marc L.

description:
Chicken Korma. Chicken Korma. Chicken Korma.

Favorite dish from my favorite Indian restaurant. No words could describe how much I love this place. I even converted my bf, with a particular distaste for Indian food, into a believer. He has even become a chicken korma addict. Every time I try and order this dish somewhere else, it simply pales in comparison. 

Also great: any of their Naans, rice, biryanis, papadums. Service is great and every time I order takeout, they like to throw in extras or offer us a free glass of wine while we wait.
On the weekends it can get super packed and loud but overall the ambiance is great.  The colors, lighting and smells are inviting and warm. The waiters are prompt and friendly. I couldn't recommend this place enough! Oh ya, and... 

CHICKEN KORMA!
author: Maysa J.

description:
Went to visit our friends in SF, and we ordered out from Roti.

Location: On West Portal Ave, in one of those neighborhoods of San Francisco that most of us Peninsula types would never find.

Look and feel: We did take out, so I only glimpsed the inside when I picked up our order.  Looked like a nice upscale bistro.

Menu: Seems like a fairly standard Indian menu, with a bit of upscale nature to it.

The food: We ordered the following dishes:

Bengan Bharta: Good flavor, with a small kick.  Not as smoky as I would have liked, but still damn tasty.

Bhindi Masala: We've really become fans of okra in Indian dishes.  This was an excellent sauteed and spiced okra dish.

Dal Saag: First time I've ever had saag with dal.  (We'll typically order lamb saag or saag paneer.)  It was an okay dish, but if I hadn't known the name of it I wouldn't have known it was a saag.  I'd much prefer ordering one of our staple saag dishes, and get the lentils on their own plate.

Macchi (Fish) Korma:  This was really good.  Perfectly cooked pieces of sea bass in a wonderful yellow cream sauce.  It could have used a few more pieces of fish, though, as this quickly became just a bowl of sauce.

Murgh Makhani: Not typically my favorite chicken dish, but the meat was very tender and the flavor was excellent.

Roti's bread basket: Tandoori Roti, Onion Kulcha, and Garlic & Basil Naan were all good, although a bit on the chewy side, but I don't think I could have always told you which was which.  Both of those complaints might have to do with it being takeout.  You just can't compete with breads right out of the kitchen.

Paratha: I wasn't all that impressed with the Paratha.  It was chewy like the others, yet at the same time it was falling apart in my wife's hands as she tried to break it into pieces for dipping.  I thought she'd have been better off putting it on her place like spaghetti and covering it with curry.

Service: The host quickly retrieved my takeout order and sent me on my merry, hungry way.

Value: It's on the expensive side for Indian food (similar to Amber India, in Mountain View.)  I did appreciate that this place charged $5-6 less for their vegetarian entrees than their meat dishes.  

Will I go back? I am quite sure this will get into the rotation of places we take out from when we visit out friends in this part of the city, and I'm totally okay with that.
author: Jason G.

description:
We went here late at night (around 8PM) and was starving and luckily found this place.  It's not the best Indian food I've had, but it's fairly decent.

Our server, Jake, was very helpful in his suggestions.  There was only 2 of us, so we didn't want to overspend on the amount of dishes we ordered.  He helped us figure out the portions and whatnot.

Here's what we ordered:

Machchi Masala (19)
Rogan Josh (17)
Basmati Pulao (5)
Parantha (5)

The fish wasn't that great, but I absolutely loved the Rogan Josh (lamb curry).  Another thing I loved?  The Basmati Pulao.  If I ever return, I would order the Rogan Josh with the Basmati Pulao.  

The price that they charge for the food is a bit extreme when it's only two people.  So you need to choose carefully on what you order, but I have a feeling that either way you'll be walking out with a significant dent on  your wallet (The overall price charged is $50.37 without tip).
author: Nina M.

description:
Roti is not only the best tasting Indian restaurant in the Bay, but also has the best service staff. Everyone there is very generous and friendly, and they care about the costumer. My food came very quickly and was delicious. Roti has GREAT Tandoori and Chicken Tikka Masala. I also highly recommend checking out the naan(s) - they're also super good! 

This place is great for a nice, quiet evening date or meeting up with a few friends. They will give you very quick, prompt service and will try to give you the best experience. Roti is a overall amazing restaurant and I'm def a fan!
author: Arjun G.

description:
I was really excited about this place, BUT unfortunately it didn't live up to my expectations. the food wasn't bad but we sat for about 45 minutes waiting for our food. no water refills during our meal, no check ins during our meal. for a place this pricy, i was expecting a lot better service. and a lot larger entrees. naan wasn't the best either. 

also there was a screaming baby. but of course this was not the restaurant's fault so i did not deduct any stars.
author: Carrie G.

description:
The "They Love us on Yelp" sticker displayed on their door is pretty misleading.  I think I'm being pretty darn generous giving this place 3 stars. Truth is it probably deserves two at best. Yes, the food is good. But its only good. I had the chicken vindaloo and my friend had the chicken palak. We also ordered the keema naan. The chicken vindaloo was fairly tasty, but nothing special. Its suppose to be a spicy dish, but this wasn't spicy in the least. It wasn't even in the medium range. My friends chicken palak was better, but still wasn't great. Very ordinary. And the naan too was just average.

But 2 some-what small entreees and 1 order of naan costing $55??? For what you get the prices are outrages. I definitely have no desire to come back here.
author: David D.

description:
Bad, bad, Bad,,, Took my dear mother there for her to try Indian Food. Was her choice, she had read about it in the newspaper and said she wanted some adventure in her life... 
FAIL.. let me count the ways:
F---service. The tall sorta cute white guy is a total Jerk. Snotty, arogant, un interesting, unhelpful, and plain rude. Threw the check at us at the end. OMG what a freakin nightmare.
F--food..... We ordered standards... Somossas,,boring very dry,,, sauces unimaginative. Yuck.
Basket of Assorted Nan.... This stuff was not good... Soggy, too thin,, way burnt.
Whole Tandori Chicken,,, FFFF.. now how can ya go wrong? Well, put like tooooooooooooo much salt/msg whatever combine it with hot spices... WTF.. this stuff was like a nightmare...
They did try to ply us with extras,but it didnt help.
Vegies,, my mother thought they were really gross and oldish tasting---FFF
Rice,,, now how can  you go wrong here? OMG very old and dry... 
1 glass of wine, 2 chais... The BILL: total Fail: 85 bucks... For absolutely garbage food.. lousy service. 
Makes me sad.. The place is kinda cute... But the folks who run the place must be on crack to think that the rude waiter, lousy food is going to make them rich. 
Forgot to mention... We were the only ones eating from 5-6:15 when we left. 
Goodnight and good luck.. Gonna hurry and finnish my review and throw it up on my "Hall of Shame"
author: Ann L.

description:
Best Indian food we've had in SF, and we eat a lot of Indian food. We haven't had anything there that isn't exceptional. The service is consistently good, and the gracious owner is always there, coming by tables to see how everything is. In the past couple of years, we have gone there with my small service dog (I have a seizure disorder) who sits quietly under the table or on my lap, and they have always been kind and accommodating about his presence. Some restaurants act like we're imposing on them, and give us nasty glares, poor service. 

Love this place, and recommend it unequivocally.
author: Laura G.

description:
I went to Roti for the first time this weekend.  My expectations were high as I had heard that it was very good, and my expectations were exceeded.  The best compliment to great food and ambiance is great service, and we got it.  I will be going back for the Murgh Malai!  And, can't wait to try other dishes.
Yum.
author: Jack M.

description: The tastiest Indian food I have ever had. The nicest restaurant manager I have ever met. What a gem of a person. Their chutneys, the chai, the saag paneer, navartan korma, every dish I've tried ranges from stunning and stellar to very good. Kormas are my favorite Indian dish. The veggie korma is better than the lamb or chicken in my book. Overall the food is fresh and fantastic. My husband and I love to go to Roti on our too rare date nights! The vivdly colored photos are also stunning. I also love the very unique rosemary naan! They also have a great wine and beer selection.
author: Melanie G.

description:
Good but not great, factor in the 2x standard indian food pricing and a 3 star review is looking quite generous.  

The Basil Naan was quite nice, but flat and floppy.  Personally I like my Naan thick and soft, not burnt, able sop up copious amounts of ghee infused creamy curry.  That is not what I found here.  The Naan we had was a limp noodle among Naans.  Luckily it made up for it in flavor, but again, if I can't use it to take up some curry then what use is it?  

The food tastes "healthy" in comparison to my usual favorite places, but also tastes watered down and lacking any real punch.  The waitress didn't ask what spice level we wanted, and to no surprise, spice was not to be found.  

The Benghan Bharta was blah, again probably missing those extra fatty calories and spices that I've come to enjoy.

The Chicken Tikki Masala which everyone raved about, well it wasn't a rave in my book.  Sure the chicken was soft and tender, but again, where is the flavor?  The best chicken tikki tastes great even without the sauce because of the over cooked flavor, none of that here.  Even with the sauce it was a boring night in taste-bud town. 

Finally, the wait.  My goodness, it took F O R E V E R to get our food.  Still even though I was starving when it arrived, there was also a huge serving of disappointment.
author: Stephen H.

description:
Updated 06/08/14 -- I believe that the presence of the owner has completely reignited the wonderful, original food and dining experience of Roti. He is very attentive, and seems to have really brought the standard back up. Good for Roti! 

I am cautiously updating my previous review about Roti. I ate there last night for the first time since I wrote my previous review. Walking by recently, I noticed there were some new servers, so I thought I'd give it another shot.

The food was great (which it always has been). The service was much improved. Our waitress was prompt, friendly, and got our order out in good time and in the correct order. (My grandpa insists on having an order of bread as an appetizer, and this seems to have caused problems in the past.) I noticed an older Indian-looking man expediting in the kitchen, and I am assuming he is one of the owners. Although I did recognize a few of the staff members, the ones I wrote about previously were not there. 

I am hoping this means the management/owners have recommitted to making this restaurant as awesome as it once was. Seriously, you used to not be able to get a table many nights, and in the past year, I've seen their popularity sink to the point that the restaurant always looked empty when I walked by. 

I'm giving them 3 stars for now, but if my future experiences continue to be great, there's no reason they shouldn't get 4 stars from me.
author: Marissa K.

description: The food is really fresh .....veggies are fresh not from frozen like  so many Indian places. Atmosphere weeeell like a new york style diner trying to be more upscale ..... and instead feels cramped dark and stuffy in contrast to the food which bountiful ....maybe we ordered too much , we ordered too much.. it's out of the way OK ...so try to make the most of it. Best when coupled with a flick at the CinéArts Empire after or before.This hood is like holiday in itself.
author: Roxanne Y.

description: The chai is served with beautiful earthenware cups and saucers.
author: Jacquee P.

description:
03.08.10

To wine or not to wine?  Their list was extensive.  Yet they ran out of the Lone Duck sauvignon blanc on the menu.  And offered something off the menu for the same price.  Whoohoo!  The pourer has a heavy hand.  Definitely worth it.  Good call to wine.

Murgh madras - Chicken curry cooked southern Indian style with coconut and golden raisins.  This dish is amazing.  We finished it rather quickly.  Goes well with both naan and rice.

Garlic and basil naan - four pieces, $5.  Totally not worth it.  Especially when it was not delicious.  We only ate half.

Makki asparagus paneer tikka - Grilled asparagus, two pieces of corn rubbed in cheese and spices, and potatoes on the side.  Sadly, we ignored this dish for the most part because the chicken curry was so good.

Finished off with a side of Roti's basmati pulao.  Good rice!

Definitely need to venture to West Portal more often.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Came here for dinner tonight with my friend hoping to convince him to enjoy Indian food! We found parking rather easily (lots of street parking on the side) and were seated quickly. We decided to start off with the assorted appetizers ($10) - which had 1 samosa, 2 deep fried veggies. These were pretty good, but pretty standard.

We also ordered the chicken tikka masala ($16) - which was pretty good. Lots of flavor, and lots of chunks of boneless chicken breast. We also ordered the spinach with potatoes ($9) which was okay - not a lot of flavor to it. The lamb briyani ($17) was good but very spicy and so I did not eat alot of this. We also got 1 roti and 1 naan ($4 each) and while it was hot and fresh, I'm used to fluffy naan - and this was kinda flat and lacked substance. Also I thought both breads were pretty oily. The mango lassi ($5) was very yummy and a big glass of it too!

While the food was decent, the prices are on the high side for Indian food. The service here was excellent, very attentive. They also have a nice wine list. I like how its an open kitchen, and the restaurant as a whole is very clean. Even the bathrooms were clean! Overall, a little pricey for Indian food, but the ambiance and service were great.
author: Betty S.

description: I love Indian food, but I don't always find a restaurant worth returning. This one, wow, it blew me away! Not only was the food to die for, but the service that was offered that was just amazing. They treated us so well. The owner is just top notch and he's really involved with his customers. You just look at how he runs his restaurant and know that he loves what he does. He makes sure that everything that happens in that restaurant is done one step above professionalism. We will definitely return and very frequently!
author: Chris H.

description: Came with a friend and was still blown away by the delish food: Yellow & Red Curry, Naan bread with fruit.
author: Aida N.

description:
My wife and I are moving to the neighborhood this weekend.  We brought some things over to the new house, and decided to try Roti Indian Bistro on West Portal afterwards.  I am thrilled that we did!

We started with Rajasthani Barvan Mirchi (goat cheese stuffed sweet peppers).  Dinner was Murgh Masala, Tandoori Prawns (Jheenga), Dal Saag, Raita, and Onion Naan.  It was a bit of a cool night, but we warmed right up from the wonderful combination of spices and flavors!  Great food, variety, and good sized portions.

The service staff was attentive, made great recommendations, and the owner Mr. Shah couldn't have been a better host.  We will be eating here regularly after our experience this evening.
author: Cy L.

description: A horrible experience had kept me away from Indian food for almost a year until I dined at Roti last Friday. It reminded me how delicious Indian curries are.
author: Herman K.

description: This is my favorite Indian restaurant.  The food is amazing!  Very delicious and spicy upon request.  Chicken tikka masala......garlic naan!  Everything that I have had there has been awesome!! Very clean and ambiance is soooo nice!
author: Arlene T.

description:
Disappointing is a word I could use here; however, while Roti did disappoint me, I did myself too. I assumed that they were the same as the Roti in Burlingame, so I set my hopes high! For one, they share the same name, but the owners are different. I must say, the owner comes across as a sweet gentleman and the service is good.

Naturally, the food tastes different. I ordered the Baingan Bharta (smoked, creamed eggplant with spices) with roti, and my husband ordered a chicken dish with rice. The sauce around the chicken was alright, not much taste going there! The eggplant didn't have that smokey taste at all! :(  And that's the key taste!! How could they!?!? 

While we enjoyed our dinner without any untoward incident, the couple whose table was next to ours had it! Walking back-n-forth in that tiny lil aisle space, an employee elbowed the man and the wine spilt on his crisp white shirt! Oh!!

I think I'm gonna stick with Roti in Burlingame :)
author: Me Iz S.

description:
This is indian food as good as it gets!

I always bring my family and friends here when they come out of town or whenever I hear the words, "I'm craving indian food!" 

Definitely try the cheese naan it was delicious!
author: Dip G.

description: Best Indian food in the city! Its some what pricey but well worth it. Machichi Korma (salmon curry) is the best thing on the menu. The restaurant is in a cool neighborhood, its nice inside, and has very friendly servers.
author: Robert F.

description: I went by here [late] last night with a couple of my friends only to have one of the most "above and beyond" restaurant experiences ever. Very cool, very sweet, very nice of them. The service is terrific, the food is DELICIOUS, and the overall feel was so welcoming and enjoyable. Thank you Roti family, we will def be back!
author: kyle w.

description: The best naan I've ever had (in America)! A little over priced for Indian food, but the service was great.
author: Sukhana S.

description:
Yes, there is one within walking distance of my condo. But there is something about dining at this location that actually makes it feel you are "dining out".

I am not a superknowallaboutIndianfoodexpert kinda guy. But I do know what I like, and Roti is what I like. Is it authentic? Probably not. But the food seems fresh and nicely prepared. The menu is extensive and I highly recommend that you go with someone who knows the cuisine, as usually I do not choose wisely.

A couple of reviewers mentioned that the tandoori duck was somewhat of a miss. I have to say, I wasn't that thrilled with it but I must preface and tell you in advance that I am not usually a fan of duck. Daffy Duck yes, Tandoori Duck no.

Don't expect a super high end dining experience, but this a nice spot to please a crowd looking for something different.
author: V B.

description:
I had been wanting to try Roti after seeing the restaurant featured on KQED.  So the perfect night arrived - a mellow Friday evening with no plans and no food in the house.  So, my husband and I decided to try Roti.  And what's more, we could ride the Muni there (it's a block from the West Portal station).

Here's the breakdown:  The food is good if you want western-style Indian food.  I personally like western-style Indian food because the meat is typically of higher quality than traditional Indian restaurants.  We ordered tandoori lamb, chicken korma, okra, rice and goat cheese naan.

So I liked the food, but the prices are so incredibly high.  I do not mind paying for high quality, but in this instance I would have rather paid much much less for traditional Indian food.  Our bill was just under $100 (for two people with one glass of wine each).  

A few other things:  
- we had to wait about 45 minutes for our food to arrive 
- one of the waiters spilled our mango chutney all over my shoe upon serving it
- the atmosphere is lacking a "homey" feel and it was too loud to talk to my date, so we just sat and smiled at each other
- the chicken korma for $22 had about five pieces of one inch square cubes of meat and tons of sauce

I would not go back.  When I want Indian, I am sticking to the "real" Indian spots at cheap prices.  But to finish off on a positive note, the food was definitely good (although my hubby and I have slightly different tastes for some cuisines, and he did not like the food here).  I have to go with 2 stars due to the prices alone.
author: Kelly A.

description:
Came here on a Wednesday night with the girlfriend since she was craving something with curry in it.  It's located at the edge of West Portal with a movie theater on its left and the MUNI tunnel to its right (forgot what that tunnel is called haha).  Parking here is cut-throat so if you've made reservations I'd suggest coming here a little bit earlier.

We walked in at 630PM without reservations and was seated within seconds by a waitress who looked no more than 16 years old (a foreshadow of the service to come).  We get seated near the back register at the edge of the kitchen.  That night it was Thanksgiving Eve so it was pretty lively in there with a bunch of white folks trying to be "worldly" before the year ended.  

We ordered the Indian Lemonade but was told they were out of lemons so we had to settle for Limeade....boo for them since it tasted like a Mojito without alcohol.  For appetizers we ordered the Vegetable Samosas (spelling?).  It was this huge fried ball filled with curry, potatoes, green peas and a whole bunch of other veggies.  For the main course we had Kashmiri Biryani, Lamb "Popsicles" and Keenan Naan (spelling?).  I loved the exotic taste of the Kashmiri Biryani!  It had 2-3 different types of rice (not your typical Asian white rice), curry, green peas, pineapples and dried raisins.  The Lamb "Popsicles" came out on a sizzling platter and literally made it go "pop" - I can see where that came from now.  The lamb chops were very juicy and tender but a little too spicy for me.  As for the Keenan Naan?  Well...it wasn't too memorable since I've already forgotten it.

Service here could use some work since it consists mainly of high schoolers trying to make enough money to go out on the weekends.  They appear to be understaffed because although there were three cooks sweating their balls off in the open kitchen, the 5 waiters were either hanging out at the register talking about how much tips they DIDN'T get (we were sitting right in front of them) or gossiping in the kitchen hallway about a fellow employee (I passed them on my way out of the restroom).

In the end I'd suggest looking for another restaurant if you really want authentic Indian food because last I checked, Indian food didn't require two forks, a knife and a spoon.  Would I come here again?  Sure but not for awhile.

==========

-1 Star for service
-1 Star for mediocre food

*3 Stars out of 5*
author: Chris Y.

description:
It has been a while since we have eaten at Roti, a neighborhood restaurant that attracts many local patrons.  Since my wife cannot take heavy spices, I ordered food that was mild and the owner was attentive enough to offer me a spicy sauce on the side since I can take the heat.  We started our meal with the sliced eggplants as well as calamari, both of which we all thought was fresh and nicely fried.  The accompanying sauces were excellent.  We also had roasted head of cauliflower that was spiced to perfection.  My mouth  still waters thinking of it.

Tandoori Prawn and Tandoori lamb followed.  Prawns tends to be a favorite amongst my family, and having eaten it at so many other restaurants, we could tell right away that they were cooked to perfection.  You can also sense that the restaurant uses really fresh ingredients.  I'm never a fan of lamb because of its unique taste, but my wife loves it.  As a compromise for eating spicy foods, we ordered the lamb popsicles.  My wife and daughter enjoyed it so much that they even convinced me to try a bite.  Even for someone who avoids eating lamb on all occasions, I have to admit that they were tender and the flavor well-balanced.  The fact that I enjoyed the lamb so much shocked my family.  We also ordered Makhani chicken and the sauce was delicious.  It was so addicting that we kept pouring it over the saffron rice and dipping the naan bread in it.  The manager was kind enough to stop by and ask how our meal was, offering my wife some cucumber yogurt to ease her tongue from what minimal spice we requested.  We also ordered the ginger beer and the mango lassi, a sweet yogurt-based drink that can help with the spice, both of which accompanied the dinner well.  We ended our meal with Kulfi, an Indian ice cream that we had never tried before.  We highly recommend it as it is not as rich and sweet as regular ice cream.  The spices gave it an interesting flavor and the topped pistachio added a nice crunchy texture.

Service was excellent as the waiters were very attentive and friendly.  It is a restaurant that we have not frequented for some time, but we will definitely return with friends.  I high recommend this restaurant.
author: Tai C.

description:
having lived and worked in the south bay we all know where the GOOD indian food is.  I came here with some old friends because one suggested indian food.  roti is in west portal which is a more convenient location for everybody.  

the place is a little dim and nicely decorated.  the atmosphere was nice but not a place for a date.  maybe good for "man dates" cuz we were eating meat and with our hands.  

the food was ok, nothing special about it.  we ordered the fried calamari for appetizer.  it was pretty good except for one of the dipping sauces.  we agreed it must've been some kind of tamarind concoction because it was sweet and tangy.  the other sauce was pretty good, creamy herb.  we were actually using it as a dip for our naan.  for our main dishes we ordered the Roti tandori special which included tandori chicken, lamb, lamb sausage, salmon and shrimp., assorted naan bread and a chicken tikka masala curry.  if I never tried indian food before I'd say this is really good but I know better.  

the waiters were really attentive.  one guy must've refilled my glass 4 times.   it was a nice for the guys to get together and catch up.   would I come back here?  probably not... but still not a bad place to eat.
author: Samson M.

description:
i think the people who work here are SO nice.

last night i got a book and went to roti to have dinner and read.

i had the cheese and spinach, and the cauliflower and potatoes. regular rice. all was delish! i love those salty flatbread round things they bring with that spicy green sauce. yum!
author: Kenna T.

description: Wow, I love this place.  I always order practically the same thing.  Their tandori Game hen is always fantastic, and their curries are great.  AND they DELIVER!!! Which is way better than the Clay Oven (which sucks) and equally priced, the only Indian place that delivers quality in this neighborhood.  Cheers!
author: Samuel Y.

description: this is amongst the best indian food i've ever had!  Indian food is often good though.  What most indian food lacks is the nice restaurant, the nice presentation, a nice ambience.  Roti indian bistro is cozy and nice.  Great for a date or nice evening out with a few friends.  The wait staff is fantastic.  I've been twice now and both times the service was perfect.  And of course the food is great.  The sauces had a zip to them which my girlfriend and i both loved.  I have tried about 40 restaurants in SF so far.  This is in my top 3.... maybe top 2!
author: Daniel R.

description: Okay, can I just say this was an INCREDIBLE! My husband and I have been to India and we love Indian food.  I don't know the names of the dishes, but with a server like Jacob, you cannot go wrong.  He provided us with amazing suggestions, and we enjoyed our appetizers all the way to our desserts.  He was an awesome server and really did a great job with taking care of us for the night.  It made our date night special.  To top it off the manager, Pankaj is a gem.  He's super sweet and super hospitable.  It was like being in a little place in India nestled in SF.  You gotta try it out...get the veggie dish with pineapple, their saffron rice is off the charts, and you can't go wrong with any dessert wine.  Have fun!
author: Mrs. M.

description:
The food wasn't awful, but not great either.  The paneer in my boyfriend's dish was not fried first which made it very bland although the sauce was nice.  

My tandoori duck was okay, but really not worth the price.  It was so over-cooked and over-seasoned, that it could have been just about any kind of meat in there.

We both ordered salted Lassi which was also very bland, thin and didn't taste like it was salted (just like drinking watered down yogurt).  The bread was good and the ambiance is really nice.

My boyfriend is Indian and has cooked a lot for me and taken me to some really authentic Indian restaurants near Washington, DC.  This one just didn't cut it for us.
author: Angelique A.

description:
I don't usually write positive reviews when a place already has good reviews, I find that redundant and unnecessary.  However, I must remark that this place has awesome Mango Lassi!!!!!  For over five bucks a pop, it better be damn good!!
 If the Mango lassi came out nasty, I would've splashed the crap at my waiter's face and smashed the glass against the wall, then stomp out of the place, taking all the food i ordered with me.  Luckily, that did not need to happen because the mango lassi was good. (but really , I wouldn't have done that even if the lassi was bad, i would've just frowned and been a sad face for dinner.)

If you're sick of cheap indian food and you think it's impossible to find a decent Indian place to eat, you're wrong! Roti Indian bistro will prove that much.  It ain't cheap.  food quality is pretty good too! 
I know it can be pricey but just do it once in a while as a treat so you can tell yourself you've had good indian food.  Not to mention, your body will appreciate that you're not feeding it cheap trash.
author: Tu L.

description:
Went here for dinner yesterday and love love loved the food. Service was excellent too. I am from India and its rare for me to find a place where the food actually tastes authentic. Over the years I have tried many many restaurants and never found one which transports me back to India. This place - perfect.
I had the Rogan Josh(lamb dish) and Navratan Korma - Perfection. The Onion kulcha was awesome. Even the raita was yummy.
Definitely going back.
author: Geetanjali G.

description: We order for delivery frequently. As we live closeish.  The food is tasty, not too oily, and reasonably priced for nice portions.  Hooray for close Indian!!
author: Keith M.

description: This is one of those quasi Indian restaurants with white people waiters looking all prim and proper in their fancy waiter duds.  A little bit pretentious for me, I'm just saying.  The food was OK, more Indian 'like' than what I've tasted before at other Indian restaurants.  I guess I like places like Nan and Curry or Pakwan other than these white table cloth places with forced ethnic/exotic ambiance.
author: barry a.

description:
This is a tough one.  I have been consistently disappointed with Roti, but went back on multiple occasions to give it another shot.  The food is phenomenal, but the service is horrible.  It's because of the food that I gave them 2 yelps instead of one.    

I don't really blame the waiters, who are all young and bubbly.  Those oldest one couldn't have been older than 20.  The thing is they are seriously understaffed in the kitchen.  It wasn't a busy night last night, and there was one cook in the kitchen.  20 minutes after placing our order, I saw the entire wait staff waiting around for food to come from the kitchen.  They have an open kitchen so you can see what's going on.  These guys were ready and willing to work (they were literally jumping around), but there wasn't food to put out.   

Last night, my girlfriend and I went here for the fourth, and likely the final time.  We were seated right away, and ordered, but waited 30 minutes for our food.  At the end of the meal, I had to ask myself if the food was worth the wait.  The meat is super high quality and the portions are good sized, and the wait staff is super friendly, but at the end of the day, it just wasn't enough. . 

Everyone knows you can get good quality Indian food in San Francisco fairly cheap.  Roti is a higher end Indian restaurant.  Clean, well lit, and in a great neighborhood. Unfortunately this is a good place to go BEFORE you're hungry, because by the time the food arrives, you'll be starving.
author: Adam E.

description: Really good North Indian food. It may initially seem that the dinner entrees are pricey, but the portion sizes are pretty good. I especially enjoyed the Paneer Makhani (the sauce was amazing, I'm curious how the chicken makhani would taste). Would recommend.
author: A I.

description:
When I first moved to San Francisco from DC, I was lonely and trying to explore all on my own. I lived in West Portal, and so spent a lot of time trying to acclimate by walking around the neighborhood and trying out new restaurants. I ended up with two I could come back to all the time: Manor Coffee, and Roti. 

First, the host as Roti is the nicest man. He took pity on me, saw that I would often come in alone, and would sometimes join me for part of my meal. He made me feel welcome and even, dare I say, special. 

The food is always wonderful as well. They have that great saffron rice which I love so much, and every kind of Indian dish you can think of. I highly recommend Roti to everyone I know, and now to you.
author: Allison A.

description:
I blame myself for not eating enough Indian food back when I was living in the South Bay.  Now I miss it.  

So pardon me while I make the comparison - Roti's vindaloo is definitely a bit on the mild side if you're used to the ones that they serve up along El Camino Real in Sunnyvale (Hellow, Passage of India!!!!!).  

But hey, it's only 10 mins walk from my place, its tandoori chicken was juicy and tender (and for $21 you get FIVE hunk of quarter chickens enough for 4 people), the naan bread was amazing and the owners are the nicest people ever. 

As if our entrees weren't enough, they kept insisting that we try all these homemade freebies (me like!) - from mango chutney, cucumber raita with pappadums, indian yogurt, to the most amazing homemade ice-cream (whole milk + cardamom + pistachio) AND a potent shot of port to cap off the meal. 

Thankfully we didn't drive - we needed the walk home!
author: Ange L.

description:
